title: Do You Need An Assistant?
text:
I am a young woman, single mom, who seeks to work for someone, short/long term, who is too busy and needs to hire a Virtual (Out of Office) Assistant. 

Qualifications:
• Excellent verbal and written communication 
• Ability to take initiative to meet/exceed expectations
• Ability to effectively prioritize tasks to meet goals/deadlines
• Proficiency in Microsoft Office Outlook (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint), QuickBooks for Invoicing, Deposits, Accounts Receivable, Accounts Payable, Paying Bills, Payroll, Data Entry, and Customer 

Administration: 
• Manage calendars, schedule and coordinate meetings, and events.
• Create and edit documents, presentations and organization charts.
• Interact with individuals at all levels of the organization.
• Arrange travel (air, flight, transportation) and Expense Reports.
• Facilitate sharing of information among internal resources.
• Handle highly confidential information discretely.
• Independently perform varied administrative duties related to functional area.
• Manage documents and filing.
• Collections 

-Assist with Special projects and support team as needed.
-Ability to handle multiple tasks and handle occasional heavy workloads in a timely manner.
-Work effectively as an integral member of a team of administrative professionals.

I am always looking for opportunity, and to grow within a company and play a vital role in helping it or you succeed. I am a very personable individual, laid back, but very professional. I love good conversation and love to learn something new everyday. 
I look forward to speaking with you and assisting with your administrative virtual needs! 


*Yes, I do realize where I am posting this ad. Posting elsewhere hasn't been successful. Please, don't be rude, or disrespectful.

title: Are you seeking sincere and lasting female friendships? Me too.
text:
I'm a kind, caring, fun, positive (most of the time- although we all have our days) caucasian woman in my late 40's, single and widowed. Have experienced many losses of loved ones. Had a beloved husband. I met one of my dearest friends via CL. She has since passed. We were close friends for a long time up until her passing. So, finding good female friendships on CL is possible! :)

I belong to wide range of meetup groups and social networking gatherings, am committed to my family, friends, myself, my work, volunteering etc but still would love to meet a few more good women friends in my age group. I have recently met some great people/pleasant acquaintances with common interests and a couple of women I am developing friendships with. However, my intention with this CL ad I'm posting is to meet a couple of closer women friends whom are in their late 40's to late 50's from similar cultural backgrounds and similar life experiences.

Life is rich when shared with others whom we feel connected and compatible. So, if you consider yourself to be a kind, nice, spiritual, intelligent woman with a wide range of interests that I share, then that's a good start. 

If you, like me, are seeking lasting friendships with other women in their late 40's to 50's whom are positive, intelligent, fun, spiritual, kind, nice women then I'd love to hear from you.

The more we have in common the better. Here are some of my interests: strong love of all animals, specifically feline inclined. I love art, visiting museums, exhibits, galleries etc. I enjoy singing, film outings, eating a variety of healthy cuisine as I lean toward vegetarian/vegan foods, but am not judgmental of the dietary desires of others. Playing scrabble over tea/coffee or a yummy hot cocoa. Going for nature walks, shopping, perusing rare book stores, the occasional theater and music outings . Free fun events around NYC. Exercising, cooking, taking day trips or weekends away and more.

Not interested in endless back and forth emailing. Seeking those serious about having a telephone conversation and if we feel compatible and comfortable, then meeting for a coffee and chat and going from there.

Looking forward to hearing from you! :)

title: Companion( non sexual)
text:
We live in the capital of the world.You step outside of your apartment and are overwhelmed with all the visual information. People, Cars, bars, parks...so much life outside! But you see yourself more times than you would like lacking someone to share some quality time with. Sometimes you are a good looking, smart person that has every men or women in the world, but for some reason you just don't feel like going on a date or maybe you are not very lucky on that department and really feel like you could use some company.
Do you find yourself more times than you would like, alone watching Netflix on a Saturday night?but would like to go to that nice concert, or go to that cute nice restaurant that just opened, or maybe just have someone to go to the movies, but just don't have the company to do so? You are single, do not want to be in a relationship right now, do not want to go to a Russian roulette date with someone you meet on OKC? Do you ever find yourself in this types of situation? Just want someone to enjoy some great things our city has to offer? If you do so....bear with me...

Please read this carefully, I am not a sexual companion! I do not offer any type of sexual services whatsoever! Got it? There are tons of people that does it, please do not email me asking for it. I do not care how much you are willing to pay. 
What i do is offering a companionship for you to just to hang out with and spend some nice, fun, relaxing, quality time together. Go to a event, to the movies, to a restaurant, a bar....you name it. You tell me where you would like to go but lacks a companion to do so and you just don't want to go by yourself or with your friends.
What can you expect? I am a very good looking Latin woman on my late 20's. Smart(get Master degree , speak 3 languages fluently). Fun, outgoing, easy-going and a good listener. So, you can definitely expect to have at least a nice, fun night or day with a smart beautiful woman. 
Can you go out with me for free? Nope, blame the Capitalist system that we live at. I am giving you my time. Time is never free, is the most valuable commodity. 
How much? It depends of what do you want to do and for how long. If you just want to go to the movies for 2 hours or you want to spend a whole day together having brunch, walking on the park, shopping, or sometimes an entire night in a event of your company... It starts at $85 an hour, just to give you an idea.


Please, only serious inquires.
Best, Allana.

title: Anybody else get tired of being fake?
text:
Sometimes, there's a purpose. Humans are naturally pessimistic, so our instinct is to have thoughts like, "Well, my roommate made that mess, so I'm just gonna leave it because it's their job" or "If my coworker keeps doing their job wrong, I'm gonna tell our boss." Instead, we'll clean the shit ourselves and try and have a pleasant conversation with them as to not feel like it was personal or fix the shit for your coworker for a while and hint to them that they should try and do things a different way... but eventually, you can't. You're not everyone's grandma.

I hate when customers come to my job and I overhear their fake-ass conversations about always wanting to collect old cars in order to impress one another or make up fake shit about the things they ordered in an attempt to sound cultured when they're saying wrong things. I've got coworkers that spitefully do no work in an attempt to get back at each other and the few that give a shit get stuck with it all. This one chick says she thinks it's wrong to talk about people behind their backs, then says she doesn't do dishes when she knows this other guy is working after her because he always leaves his own dishes behind. BUT HES A GREAT GUY. I DONT TALK ABOUT PEOPLE. It's all weakness. It's gross. That kinda crap is just a way to devalue their day-job as being "just a job" since it helps them prioritize their passions and gives them excuses of fake hardship that they've dealt with. No, bitch. You spent the entire shift on your phone. You coulda spent 10 minutes doing dishes and 3 minutes wiping tables. I spent 5 hours getting you ready for your shift. At least have some level of pride and character.

I dunno. I'm really tired of being nice. Some customers come in and start crying about losing a loved one at 7 A.M. and my first thoughts are, "My dog died 2 years ago. It still hurts. Losing her hurt more than losing any human relative. Can't mention that though cuz' she lost a human and she'd feel insulted. Not sure how to respond... It's 7 A.M." but then if there's a fire in the news and I try and mention that after another person tells me about it, I get looked at like I just admitted to strangling a baby. There's some sorta statistic about how people lie on average twice every minute... and if you think about what we omit and justify to ourselves, it could be true. In those interactions I had to decide on what to hold back or not say. Those are basically lies. I'm constantly telling myself that I'm doing the right thing cuz' I wanna be proud of myself and unconditionally supportive of whoever works the next shift regardless of who it is, but it's mostly that I wanna just feel like I'm better than the scrubs I work with and don't want to have to go home feeling like i'm blaming people and having negativity looming over me.

I recently had a girl give me her number. That hasn't happened to me in a crazy long time. I've never "dated." I always just ended up in relationships after being friends. I went through the whole, "Do I text? Do I call? Do I wait a day?" thing and ended up texting the next day. She never responded and I haven't even seen her walk by to go to work since then. "Jesus. Did this bitch quit her fucking job and move home just to avoid me? She was hanging out at 7 A.M. on the dot to chat with me in the morning and sometimes bought NOTHING! I bet it was cuz' I texted. I know when I get texts, I respond by telling my phone to leave me alone. Can't give people a chance to overthink things. I bet that's why. I'll have to call next time... even though I hate calling people." Life is pretty dumb. Much easier to just not care and watch porn all day and they daydream about people from your past. Wish I could not care.

title: Massage

I use either scented or unscented oils, depending on your preference and this can be a partial massage or a full body massage, again depending on your preference. I am knowledgeable in Swedish massage techniques and I have very strong hands so I can also do deep pressure massage. I often combine the two, depending on the person, especially in the upper back, where most people carry a lot of tension. title: Duck-Face Selfies, and Short Attention Spans - And We're Lonely Why??
text:
Does anyone even have the attention span to read through this post? Let's find out.

Seriously. Does anyone in this emotionally-bankrupt, mentally-shallow, tech-toy obsessed, social media dependent society have an attention span long enough to make - and KEEP - a friend? Lover? Romantic interest? Even call in a fucking pizza order and still be interesting in eating it when it's delivered? 
I'm sick of reading posts from women who bitch and moan about being alone, lonely, and in need of friends, and when they get a reply from an awesomely sweet, funny as hell guy, they express their giddy joy of finally finding Mr Right, followed by a day or 2 of "oh my goddd you're so awesome" email exchanges, until....they see a piece of shiny aluminum foil. Or Kum Kartrashian's new ass implants steal the show, and then it's bye bye giddy joy of finally finding Mr Right. Well, they WERE blissfully happy to find a dream-come-true friend, but then someone on Fakebook uploaded a new ecard to express their philosophy on life, or they had to upload their own lunch pics to Instagram, in order to gain 100 "likes" to give them the self esteem necessary to eat the fucking slop. Priorities are definitely in order here. And I'm not even exaggerating! I post here too often, for friends, romance - anything. My "agenda" here is simple. I want...need...crave a "connection" of any sort. An occasional chat bud, friend, best friend, casual date, maybe even my future ex-soul mate would be great to connect with, BUTTTT - and I mean this, literally - every single connection I make with some self-professed "highly interested" female, is null and void after a few days TOPS! Tops. Could it be me? Perhaps, if my sweet, compassionate, wickedly funny personality that got them hooked on me, in the first place, suddenly became their Kryptonite. How can you be obsessed with me today, but "oh, I just got distracted" tomorrow...and the next day...week...month? Am I the only one with an attention span long enough to connect, and STAY connected with someone who I really like? If I like you, I will be your unconditional friend til the end. I will support you in your darkest times, and share your joy, in your brightest. And if I love you...brace yourself for the biggest self-esteem boost imaginable. I will drown you in flattery, and smother you with romance. Gratuitous public displays of affection will happen. Ever cuddle in church? You don't know what you're missing! And even if we are just simply casual friends, I will entertain you beyond your heart's content. 
There's a reason why everyone is so lonely and bored in this tech-era. Everyone wants to connect with everyone, but no one has the attention span to STAY connected with a single human being. We only wanna "stay connected" (as it's advertised) with Fakebook, and all other mind-numbing anti-social media outlets. We thrive on digital "thumbs up" and "friend" points that we sadly equate with REAL friends. Try calling any of your countless FB friends when you need to vent your shitty day, or better yet - try to even identify any of those bogus assholes on the street! Most are anonymous "points" that somehow validate our self esteem, by convincing us that we have actual, living, breathing friends. And we wonder why we are lonely. Proof of our collective loneliness: Selfies. Why are selfies so popular? Simple. Since no one has any real friends to take pics of them, they have to take their own. And usually in front of a smudged mirror, in a grimy public toilet stall, while they give their best fishyduck faces. Oh yea, looking like a blow fish, washed up on shore, gasping for air, is soooooo sexy, ladies! The mongoloid-orgasm face is totally Vogue, Cosmo, Vanity Fair, and Mad Magazine all combined. And before you rebut with "Oh, but guys are turned on by it" let me pop your bubble. Guys are attracted to the fact that you have 3 holes that they can plug up. No other reason. They don't like you because of your duck face, they like you DESPITE that grotesquely repulsive shit you pose with. And in all fairness, to the guys who think it's way cool to throw up the faux white boy gang signs, and upside down peace signs....IT'S NOT!!! God doesn't anyone just fucking smile in pics anymore?? Does anyone have reason to smile and be happy? Maybe if your attention spans were long enough to connect and stay connected with people....ya think?
So this rant covered a lot, but my main goal was to ask what may be the rhetorical question of whether or not anyone has any real interest in making any real connection with a fellow real human. Maybe if I post this for the next year or so, I will make my jackpot quota of just 1 real connection. HAHA!
I'm a super-sweet, sensitive, caring, romantic, passionate, funny-as-the-shit-you-just-read---guy. I'm pitifully single, white, with zero kids. I do not smoke and am obsessively healthy. Ripped body and abs of steel = check.
Your age, race, and all the other shallow BS that people list as important mean nothing to me. If we can get along and connect in any way...jackpot. If we can STAY connected...hahahahahahahaha funny, eh?:)
Hey, if you managed to read this entire post...you're off to a great start!
I'm a SWM, with the body of a Greek god, and the sense of humor of Robin Williams (before he decided to stop pretending to be happy).

title: In too deep
text: Perhaps you're married or In a serious relationship and feel something just isn't right. You feel great love and care for that person dearly yet you find yourself constantly at odds with one another. You are complete opposites yet much the same. But deep down inside you know it just isn't right and cant seem to find away out of it. Well that's me in a nutshell. I'm in a relationship with a wonderful woman, beautiful both inside and out. A kind and caring soul who loves me with all my flaws. I just cant get over the fact that we agree on absolutely nothing. From where I should be living to how I should be living. We share some common interests but not many. Every time I approach the issue that we cant agree on anything it's kind of dismissed and that our love is the only foundation we need. Now not only am I a realist but I tend to think way to logically. This is literally killing me, eating me inside. The minute the feeling quells and things feel harmonious again....Something comes up and the feeling is back and I'm once again dismissed. Even when I think its over, and I explain my unhappiness....It will be ok...LOVE! I guess I'm here because of the semi anonymous nature of CL and in the hopes someone reads this and says "Hey I know how he feels" So this isn't about sex or finding a new relationship. It's about sharing experiences and perhaps finding a friend to figure it all out with. Need to knows? I guess at this point an age (44), sex (M) and...Well that's it for now

title: IS THERE ANYONE--JUST ONE PERSON--LONELY OUT THERE TOO? (30-55)
text:
Hi, and thank you for your interest so far. I am about 5'11" tall, average build and work in Manhattan.

I know people have told me not to put too much detail into this post, but I want to begin by being HONEST about my circumstances, what I am looking for, and HOPEFULLY someone out there will have either been in a similar situation, or at least be able to empathize to the point of (I hope) a cup of coffee, at least.

First of all about AGE? Doesnt matter.. all my life was in relationships with my age.. yet last gf was 21 and I am late 50s. We were together as a couple for 3 years. She was tired of guys her age who only wanted her for the physical, then left her. She wanted someone more Mature who would truly take time to get to know her as a person. Someone Older who would listen to her thoughts, feelings, respect, care for her.

And romantically, someone more Mature who would take time for warmth, affection, Tenderness. Someone who would go slow---hold hands, cuddle, be gentle.

That is why it worked.. and why it PROVES when it comes to age it is truly just a number. For feelings are Universal at any age.

So if you are in my age range, fine. But if younger, doesnt matter!

Either way!

OK so that being said, here goes (LOL):

Some time ago I lost many things at once:

1) Girlfriend of 7 years (she broke up);

2) Best male friends of 20 years (they did not die but went their own way)

3) My car

4) My job (D0NT WORRY I have a good job now)

5) And my own place (share for now w/ex wife... purely financial reasons.. she dates.. i date.. 2 separate lives --divorced for 10 years now, can prove it and saving to get OWN place again in 4 months).

Subsequent to all those losses, I did make 1 true friend (platonic) and was in a relationship with a woman for 1-1/2 years, which ended a few months ago (she moved out of NY).

At this point, I am seeking a friend to talk to, to do things with.

I AM SO TIRED of doing everything ALONE.. it HURTS!

Id like to meet a pleasant, warm female companion to share things with.. movies, walks, anything we have in common.

I enjoy bowling, outdoors, LOVE nature.. fresh air, trees, and music.

Love All kinds of music pretty much.. books, movies

But most especially just being with a special person.

It is NOT easy to be ALONE in NY. And despite the fact I have recovered pretty much from what I pointed out in the 5 points above, being alone again now. Just feels empty.. especially around the holidays!

I put this ad in BOTH the platonic section AND the dating section because I am OPEN to both friendship AND romance.

I happen to be a very Affectionate person, love to hug, cuddle? I love it.

Ultimately, I am looking for a woman I can CHERISH, treasure for her mind, heart and soul? a woman who wants a man who will be LOYAL, TRUSTING, who will stand by her no matter what.. who will be her best friend, her soulmate.

A man who she can turn to at all times.. to lean on for strength, emotional support. Who will be tender, gentle, and loving.

If ure looking for that too.. not a man who plays games but a man who can be DEVOTED, WARM, loving, a good listener.. empathic.. im here!

I am college educated, and FIX COMPUTERS on the side.. so if u need any help with your computer, feel free to ask.

OK that's about it. IF you are looking for an older man or a man your age that you can talk to, lean on, who will listen to your feelings or just have fun with, please write me.

All I ask is that if you are interested, to meet for coffee and talk.. that?s all I ask. IN PUBLIC of course so u feel SAFE.. and play it all by ear from there.

In return u would meet a man who:

1) has UNLIMITED LOYALTY

2) has UMLIMITED affection

3) is a good listener

4) is someone u can turn to for support, strength, encouragement

5) will be tender, romantic, sensual, gentle, loyal, just, kind and warm

If interested all I ask is to meet for coffee in public.. that's all I ask.

Hope to hear from you, Norman

P.S. I have a Car if that helps. LOL

title: Wanna actually be friends?
text:
Like, not people who go see a movie as friends and then try and sleep together and go home and block each other on their phones and shit. Like, people who go to out to eat and talk shit about their jobs, are supportive of one another, talk about their crushes and the people they got a number from that they're afraid to call and the people they slept with that licked their armpit and turned them the fuck off. I'm a very unfiltered person and I don't get to be myself very often. I like sharing the first thing that pops into my head, but I'm generally an optimistic pessimist. I'll point out some bullshit, but in a hopeful way that suggests that people will grow from it... like today I saw my old boss walk out of a massage parlor in sweat pants with frizzy hair and he pretended to not notice me and whipped out his phone to give himself an excuse to avert his eyes. 

I posted that shit on Facebook and my old coworkers messaged me laughing about it... and this gay guy dishwasher starts telling me we should hang out. I'm happy about that... and then he says we should "Netflix and Whiskey." Sorry, bud. I rejected your offer to blow each other in the basement a year ago and it's still not tempting. They both felt guilty and while that's not a great example, they'll probably be less likely to bee as sleazy next time... maybe not. I dunno. There was a news story about a boy on a HIgh School wrestling team getting "mat herpes" earlier. Reminded me of the myth of getting pregnant by sitting on a toilet seat. "THERES NO WAY MY SON GOT HERPES FROM KISSING HES AN INNOCENT ANGEL IT MUST BE THE WRESTLING MATS!" No, mom. Johnny was kissing a boy named Matt, not the wrestling mat. That's not how herpes works.

Send me a message. Tell me about your darkest and creepiest fantasies you've had in those last moments before falling asleep or all of the pathetic shit you did on your last day off that you'd be embarrassed to admit. I'm gonna go to sleep now and probably try and dream about getting a hug from my teenaged coworker cuz' I haven't had any action in months and that's how desperate my brain is. "Sex? Pfft! Even clothed momentary closeness is more than you can hope for!" Sad. I'd wanna chat for a bit and then actually do a thing in person at some point. I have no friends, really. Eat food, explore and molest mannequins in boutiques, pet peoples dogs for way too long and make them uncomfortable, make fun of hipsters, sit on a stoop with a flask of expensive bourbon, etc... I don't own a flask, though. Think I'm gonna order one. I like the idea of that.

title: Open Letter...
text:
Hello,

I'm seeking someone smart and compassionate. Someone who can value who am I.

Before I describe more about myself, know that I have herpes. I get "cold sores" (hsv-1). I want to be totally honest about it because people were not with me. I'm not promiscuous, nor do I want this virus to define me. I am more than this skin condition and won't make it my priority. I will be responsible and do my best to contain it and not spread it to those that I value, respect and love. But I cannot guarantee you that I may not pass it on to you any more that I can guarantee I won't give you the flu if I ever catch it and we are together. Please understand that a virus may be spread even without having visible symptoms. And before you start judging me, know this, doctors, including yours probably, lied to you about having you tested for hsv when you went for a general physical. Fact: doctors do not include herpes testing on general std exams unless you explicitly request it, twice most likely. So, most people do not even know they have the virus because they may have never shown any symptons.

Moving this aside, do not think this virus makes me be worth any less than other people. If you think that, move along, you aren't the one I seek. I'm mature and have grown significantly throughout my life. I understand what being an adult really is. I am compassionate, direct, honest, caring, respectful and intelligent. I am also down to earth, curious, imaginative, sympathetic, nonjudgmental, sarcastic, and perhaps a bit fun(ny)? I am employed, independent and thoughtful. 

I am in my early 30s, non smoker, not much of a drinker, enjoy the outdoors and staying fit. 

If you are interested, reach out and let's get to know each other. I hope I find my special girl someday...

Thank you.

title: Incandescence of lava
text:
"Under the solid, sustaining foundation of earth: the roiling liquid incandescence of lava."

Above's a bastardized quote from Bataille. I like it because it suggests the beautiful, even dangerous Reality underlying what we comfortably rest our heads against day in, day out. Concepts, concerns, questions which have battered at people's spirits and souls since people could wonder. Stuff that can't be quantified and digitized or Facebook status-ed. Questions most people do their best to avoid worrying over except for brief heady stints in college: How to live? Where do we come from, where are we going? What unseen rules govern all we do?

I'm looking for someone to exchange emails with about all of that and more. You should be a seeker, and interested in discussing mystics, thinkers, poets and artists from any time, any place. You should be humble enough to be taught; happy, in turn, to teach. You should be sane and funny and analytic and sensitive and poetic. You can be partnered or not, but be okay with the idea of a respectful pen-pal friendship. Women tend most often to have the kind of energy-blend I'm looking for, but if you're a man who's stumbled upon this, and you feel like responding, go for it. 

We may meet, we may not -- probably not -- I don't care which -- what I care about is the quality and passion of your thinking and to what degree you can translate that to prose. To begin with: What question(s) are you wrestling with? And/or: What writer or artist has stirred you recently to really struggle with a question there's no safe and simple answer for?

title: Being an adult is tough
text:
I keep seeing this news pop-up thing that shows a picture of Jane Seymour and a caption saying something like, "She had to live out her worst fear." She's an actress... at least 50 years old... but all I know her from are those commercials about the "open heart collection" around Valentine's Day a few years ago. My first thought every time I check my e-mail and see her picture is, "I'd totally eat her asshole." Not sure if that's the response they're trying to illicit. To a degree, that kinda shit has gotta be flattering to chicks, right? I've been creeped on by gay guys a few times, but with them it was always super aggressive... like inviting me to the basement at work to blow each other or a 40+ yr old dude who looks like Super Mario/Ron Jeremy asking me if he could interview me about sexuality. I guess it matters if you find the other person attractive and if you know for sure if it's just an unfiltered passing thought or a serious "I WILL BRING YOU TO MY BASEMENT FOR TEA AND CRUMPETS WITH ANAL BEADS" mission that they're on.

I've gotta get shit done. My bedroom is supposed to have double doors, but I ripped one off when I was a kid cuz' it kept getting slammed and it would pinch the coaxial cable for the internet and kick me offline, so I flipped out one year and dragged the door into the park and left it there. Now, my family left and I have the apartment and I have roommates that giggle and fart and open and close the windows at all hours of the night waking me up. Greetings, Creative Ones!

I'm a writer (of fiction and poetry) who is interested in finding another literary-minded person for mutual support and constructive criticism. This could be something like a writers' group, but for two. While we could trade work and comments via the web, I'm most interested in meeting face-to-face fairly regularly.

Though I write fiction in various genres, I am focusing upon contemporary fantasy and science fiction at this time. I do enjoy many different kinds of fiction from mainstream and literary through several of the genre ghettos. Whatever it is that you write, the person I am looking for must have an appreciation for contemporary fantasy and science fiction - if you don't, then we probably aren't a good match.

As for poetry, I'm open to many different styles.

What creative endeavors are you pursuing at the moment?

If you are passionate about writing and strive to improve your art, then I'd love to work with you. For me, writing is a vocation that demands far greater effort than a hobby would. 

If this sounds at all interesting to you, please do reply! I'm open to any ideas along these lines.

I hope you all have an amazing, productive day!

Our relationship would be ongoing but totally private and secure. Another thing, I am not looking for anyone young. title: IS THERE ANYONE--JUST ONE PERSON--LONELY OUT THERE TOO? (30-55)
text:
Hi, my name is Norman. I am about 5'11" tall, average build and work in Manhattan.

I know people have told me not to put too much detail into this post, but I want to begin by being HONEST about my circumstances, what I am looking for, and HOPEFULLY someone out there will have either been in a similar situation, or at least be able to empathize to the point of (I hope) a cup of coffee, at least.

First of all about AGE? Doesnt matter.. all my life was in relationships with my age.. yet last gf was 21 and I am late 50s. We were together as a couple for 3 years. She was tired of guys her age who only wanted her for the physical, then left her. She wanted someone more Mature who would truly take time to get to know her as a person. Someone Older who would listen to her thoughts, feelings, respect, care for her.

And romantically, someone more Mature who would take time for warmth, affection, Tenderness. Someone who would go slow---hold hands, cuddle, be gentle.

That is why it worked.. and why it PROVES when it comes to age it is truly just a number. For feelings are Universal at any age.

So if you are in my age range, fine. But if younger, doesnt matter!

Either way!

OK so that being said, here goes (LOL):

Some time ago I lost many things at once:

1) Girlfriend of 7 years (she broke up);

2) Best male friends of 20 years (they did not die but went their own way)

3) My car

4) My job (D0NT WORRY I have a good job now)

5) And my own place (share for now w/ex wife... purely financial reasons.. she dates.. i date.. 2 separate lives --divorced for 10 years now, can prove it and saving to get OWN place again in 4 months).

Subsequent to all those losses, I did make 1 true friend (platonic) and was in a relationship with a woman for 1-1/2 years, which ended a few months ago (she moved out of NY).

At this point, I am seeking a friend to talk to, to do things with.

I AM SO TIRED of doing everything ALONE.. it HURTS!

Id like to meet a pleasant, warm female companion to share things with.. movies, walks, anything we have in common.

I enjoy bowling, outdoors, LOVE nature.. fresh air, trees, and music.

Love All kinds of music pretty much.. books, movies

But most especially just being with a special person.

It is NOT easy to be ALONE in NY. And despite the fact I have recovered pretty much from what I pointed out in the 5 points above, being alone again now. Just feels empty.. especially around the holidays!

I put this ad in BOTH the platonic section AND the dating section because I am OPEN to both friendship AND romance.

I happen to be a very Affectionate person, love to hug, cuddle? I love it.

Ultimately, I am looking for a woman I can CHERISH, treasure for her mind, heart and soul? a woman who wants a man who will be LOYAL, TRUSTING, who will stand by her no matter what.. who will be her best friend, her soulmate.

A man who she can turn to at all times.. to lean on for strength, emotional support. Who will be tender, gentle, and loving.

If ure looking for that too.. not a man who plays games but a man who can be DEVOTED, WARM, loving, a good listener.. empathic.. im here!

I am college educated, and fix computers on the side.. so if u need any help with your computer, feel free to ask.

OK that's about it. IF you are looking for an older man or a man your age that you can talk to, lean on, who will listen to your feelings or just have fun with, please write me.

All I ask is that if you are interested, to meet for coffee and talk.. that?s all I ask. IN PUBLIC of course so u feel SAFE.. and play it all by ear from there.

In return u would meet a man who:

1) has UNLIMITED LOYALTY

2) has UMLIMITED affection

3) is a good listener

4) is someone u can turn to for support, strength, encouragement

5) will be tender, romantic, sensual, gentle, loyal, just, kind and warm

If interested all I ask is to meet for coffee in public.. that's all I ask.

Hope to hear from you, Norman

P.S. I have a Car if that helps. LOL

title: Your mission, should you choose to accept it...
text:
...is to hang out with me! 

I know, that doesn't sound so great, but hear me out. Cake is involved. 

I moved here fairly recently and thought it was about time I started attempting to make friends. As such, I'm looking to meet new and fascinating people. Or new and mildly interesting people, if that's all you have to offer. Beggars can't be choosers, I guess. 

I'm a rather low-key person, so I personally prefer quiet outings to museums, parks, zoos, monasteries, mime colleges, space vacuums...stuff like that. That being said, I should probably at least attempt to break free from my comfort zone, so I'd be willing to try other stuff. I'm sure we'd be able to find something fun to do, because we're both awesome people, right? Hell yeah. *high five* I'm going to pretend you did it back. I'm also going to pretend it's 1997 and it's still cool to high five. 

If you're still reading this, good for you. You're one step closer to cake. 

All I'm really looking for in a friend is someone capable of laughing, not just at the world around them, but at themselves. I just don't get along with people who take themselves too seriously and can't joke back and forth. 

So that's about it. Hopefully I'll hear from someone cool and engaging. And if you're a serial killer, I'm not falling for any of your crap. Fool me twice, shame on me. 

Oh, and by the way...

The cake is a lie.

title: I Love Being Alone! Loneliness is Awesome Too! - Said No One Ever!
text:
I've been alone, in my life, but with the hope, and belief that, someday, I will be able to connect with someone - as I always have. I've been in LTRs for 21 years. I've had 4 very INsignificant others who all cheated and left me for dead (not literally). And with each broken heart, I always swore the same "NEVER AGAIN!" mantra , but..stupid is as stupid does, and stupid me always gave my heart out like a discount store flier in Times Sq. Heartache, disappointment, and now...hopelessness. I no longer believe that I will find anyone who I can truly, deeply connect with. I've abandoned the hope of ever having what every human organically needs: Companionship and Unconditional love. A best friend and lover in one total package. No biggie for most people, but for me, it seems an impossible dream. Like trying to find an honest politician, or a taxi driver in Manhattan who has a clue where the hell he's going. None of these exist. And this is where being "alone" ends, and being "lonely" begins. My world is devoid of intimacy, romance, true friendship, and someone who will laugh at my jokes even when they are not funny - even though ALL my jokes are fucking hilarious! Just sayin. I'm typing this on a dark, dreary, rainy night - the time best spent wrapped in puffy blankets, feeling the body heat of that special someone, held tightly against you, and you literally melt into each other's souls. I live for that bliss, but I've lost hope of ever having it ever again. There's always a needle in the haystack, but I'm tired of getting pricked in my ass searching for it. I'm not a pessimist, I'm a realist. I've given the very core of my being to too many, too often, only to be used, abused, and left for...CL. Above me, is the dude who wants to "mentor" aka fuck some teenage college student, and below me, a zoomed in closeup of a cock from Jurassic Park, seeking an "NSA FWB WITH AN BBW." Actually, he's really a Nigerian scammer, as 98% of these ads are, but hey - a little identity theft never hurt anyone, now did it?
This is what I'm reduced (or elevated?) to. 
So what am I looking for? Why post this? Don't know. Maybe I'll make a cool email buddy or phone friend, or someone who can relate to me? Misery lusts company. I think just going with the flow is my best bet. Whatever or whoever comes of this post...welcome to my world. Have a seat. Tell me about you. It's not Twitter, so feel free to exceed the 140 word limit. 
I'm a white guy, a certified Personal Trainer (with abs of steel;), no kids, a nature and animal lover, sensual, intensely sexual, funnier than Sophia Viagra's version of English, and lonely why? (insert Final Jeopardy music here
*I AM A MAN*MAN*MAN*MAN*MAN*PLEASE NO MORE DICK PICS !

title: Trust Takes Years to Build...But Just Seconds Break. So, Why Cheat?
text:
Sooo, yeah, I have been cheated on, and of course, the relationship is over, but it feels like my happiness, in general, is over too. Does happiness ever return, when your "soulmate" betrays everything that your love was based upon? Not even total happiness, but just a simple smile... I cannot even fake one of those. Even if you are just dating someone, for a short while, why cheat on them? Have the guts to end the relationship, and be free, to do whatever you want, and not have to live with the guilt, of breaking the heart, of someone, who lived to love you... To care for you... To honor, cherish, treasure, and all that other sappy BS, that relationships are built upon, until they prove to be a big, fat lie. A hoax. how can anyone be so heartless?
Better question, is, how can we be so stupid, to think they had a heart, in the first place?
Some cheaters will never feel that guilt.
But those of us who get cheated on, will never feel a reprieve, from that betrayal.
I'm sure many of you can relate, but if anyone would like to talk about it...

SWM (I better get used to having to add the "S" to my status).
42. 
Empty.

title: Please give me two million dollars
text:
Imagine you are walking by on a busy city street and you see a person in need. They make their need clear and through obvious means, but they aren't bothering anyone (ex: a person sitting cross legged with their palms out and a sign).

You are in the position to easily change their life by giving them a bit of what you have, that you aren't using, that isn't going to change your daily life whether you give it away or not. Regardless of how much work you've put in, you aren't going to miss it, since it isn't doing anything sitting in the bank or in a stockpile somewhere.

You aren't giving to them because they are sick or have some kind of defect or because they are poor. This is above that. There's no pity or emotion. This is about giving because you are in the position to do so, and because you can. Nothing more.

Quietly, you slip into this person's hand something that has the potential to change their life - a check for an inconsequential amount to you, but more than a lifetime's worth for them. 

You leave it to fate to see what happens, with no regrets. This act of kindness (or a gamble as some may see it) will just be between you and the One upstairs. 

Who knows - you may see this person again someday, but it's more likely they will fade into the background never to be heard from again. But you can rest easy knowing you've done a good deed and given someone a chance - an opportunity that you know you would have taken if it had ever happened to you.

You walk on and continue with your life. This is just another day. You've given back to the universe just as it has given to you, and life is good.

title: Do you give a shit about your job?
text:
I feel like no one does, anymore. I try to be super positive at work, cuz' I spend half my damn day there with those people. I'll leave them messages thanking them for doing a great job closing the shop and drawing something funny or I'll hang out late during a shift change to help finish something... while they just text people on their phone... and I take my job itself super seriously. I have fun conversations with my regulars and even when I'm in a crappy mood, I try and teach myself new ways to stay positive for their sake and it eventually boosts my own mood. My coworkers have said things like, "It's just a job" and "Our interactions with them are fake and temporary and don't matter" or "So and so never does dishes, so I didn't do any last week since he worked next but he just didn't care anyway and then the morning person had to do it..." and "Yeah, I dunno what that mess is. Someone else made it, so it's not my problem." The fuck? It's a JOB... and you work with other humans. Do you not have pride or responsibility or discipline or... what the fuck?

I feel like everyone should constantly want to grow as people. What's the point of life if not to become as complete of a person as possible and learn as much as you can to help the next generation get there sooner in their life and go even further? I grew up in a crazy negative household. Everyone communicated with passive aggressive actions and hateful comments, so I learned to not speak, ever. If I said something good or encouraging or bad or mentioned the weather or a life goal or how did at school... it would always be met with a complaint or argument. I went years just nodding and not even speaking words with my face. Now, I try my best to communicate in new ways. I'm shy as fuck on the inside, but I work behind a counter and customers come in (sometimes) not even to buy anything and just want to hang out and talk to me! It's amazing. It makes my day... and then a coworker takes over and I try and be as nice as possible to them and they tell me shit that makes me feel like an idiot for caring. Sorry that I just spent my entire shift running around making as many waffle cones as humanly possible so that you don't have to deal with it and making cold brew and stamping every damn cup in the store and cleaning the bottom of the fridges none of you give a shit to clean and tons of other things I could drone on and on about, but please, tell me how my customers don't care about me while you text your roommate you have a bad relationship with to clean their dishes in a snotty way. It's probably natural to devalue your day job when you're failing at your personal passion since that helps you push aside your doubts reinforces your focus, but fuck pride, right? If you blame others and find faults rather than strive to do the right thing cuz' you wanna think of yourself as a person who does the right thing for the next guy, how do you expect to keep yourself motivated?

I get a lot out of service jobs. I only like to work jobs where I have regulars now. Sadly, I sometimes feel like they're my only damn friends. Even when a coworker wants to hang out after work, I'll still feel closer to the nanny who comes in every day to talk about TV shows and our hopes and dreams and families and embarrassing childhood stories and scars and crap than I will with the coworker who hates our job that I just watched a show with sitting side by side. 

Do others take their jobs personally anymore? Am I crazy person? Do people value or strive for personal growth in whatever ways they can? Is this a generational thing? My coworkers are all a few years younger than me... for the most part. Maybe I'm crazy. Maybe I'm the only sane one.

title: Ladies: How would you have handled: a "Missing" Ring & My Sister: Help
text:
Hi All,

I had two separate packages (the same size; from the same company) sent to my sister's place in another State; one was for me, the other was a gift for her. Even though both packages were tracked as delivered on the same day at the same time, she told me only one package was delivered. Her husband really doesn't like me, so if he checked their mail before she did, I wouldn't put it past him to have stolen one of the packages. 

When I speak with the mailman tomorrow; later today... and it's confirmed that two packages were delivered and her husband did steal one of the packages, she will finally see that her husband is very vindictive and hateful towards me. Everything happens for a reason.

Let's say he did steal one of the packages:
It is now 11:55 pm and she's not answering her phone, nor responding to my txt messages for her to call me back about the situation, so I don't know if her item is in the package or mine. My question is, should I have her reimburse me for the missing item? I told her to mail the package tomorrow without opening it, which means I may get her "gift." It makes sense that she'd have to reimburse me if it is my item that's missing, but if I get her gift, I can just give it back to her when I see her. I'm afraid that she's going to keep the item and I will never know if it was for her or me. That would be really sad, because it would say something about her relationship to me. 

I would like your advice. This is just another mean thing that her husband has done to me, if he did it. Or if someone else did it, the question still remains. Ultimately, either she will be without a gift, or she'll have to reimburse me for my merchandise. 

Thank you.

3.3.16 - 6:09 am UPDATE EVERYONE:
My sister just called and retracted her "statement:" "TWO packages actually came!!" She added, "I thought I told you two packages came," when at the time, she repeated herself saying, "Your package came," and for the next few days we kept communicating about when her package would arrive!! She would say, "It will come soon." Something is fishy! But she started to "stride right" after I told her that I was going to speak with her mailman, and she knows I would have contacted her building management after that. I hate to speculate, but the mailman is right when he scans two different tracking numbers into the USPS system... Either she was lying the whole time, or she got her a.h. husband to confess!! In light of it "suddenly appearing;" errr, her saying, "I told you your packages came," Oh, mid typing this to you all, at 7 am, she called me back to say that she thought that a package would arrive with her name on it (3rd, mind you), which is why she said, "Your package." She's lying because she clearly kept saying, "I have your packagE in my bag;" and "I have your packagE in my closet." WOW!! What is the world coming to if I can't even trust my sister????? 

In my bewilderment, I immediately reordered the item for myself. I was up until 12 am communicating with the manufacturer about the delivery and lost some sleep over this unnecessary drama. I've asked her to mail both packages to me and I will be returning them to the manufacturer. I guess unless she came clean with the truth all of you may have handled it this way. I'd love to her feedback. I don't know what else to say...

3.4.16 - 9:40 am

Hi All, my sister txt'd me this morning that she has mailed both packages to me. My conundrum: I don't know if I will return her ring or give it to her, even though I did tell her that when I see her, I will give the ring as we'll be in better spirits. (I haven't decided if I will keep my ring which I've reordered, and have one resized for my left hand...) Can someone give me advice, because since I don't know what really happened with the "second package," I don't know if my sister was involved with the mystery or not, hence I want to return her ring. I feel like she should suffer the consequences of the deception. I've also thought about just waiting until this year is over and giving as a Christmas gift, or her Birthday in June, or Mother's Day in May... 

I understand that spouses come before blood relatives, and I guess I should accept that if her a.h. husband did steal the package and then came clean about it; which is why she is now saying that she told me "your packageS arrived," my sister will always protect her husband, him a being a liar, thief, and all. What hurts me the most is that even though she's admitted that it puts her in an awkward situation with his doing hurtful things to me (she knows I've never done anything to offend him), she doesn't get in his face about it, as in she doesn't go hard. I told her that if I were married, and my husband did those things to her, I'd tell him, "Don't you EVER touch my sister's things again, and if you do it again, we're gong to have a problem!" I'd seriously consider divorce if my husband deliberately hurt my sister or made her feel uncomfortable in any way. It says a lot. I don't go there anymore.

Believe me, there are lots of people who go through these shows with fun, but there are some who suffer some embarrassing effects afterwards and are just too afraid to share.

text:
Double Date?

My best friend and I are looking for two best friends (or comparable) to join us at rooftop/nightclub/bar hopping this week... we're both very social creatures, so let's be social together...

We're are 5'10, 160lbs and 5'11', 170lbs, he's a screenwriter that loves to travel and I'm a social media guru who takes dance classes in his spare time.. We're VGL, in great shape, funny and sarcastic as hell..

All in all, we're looking for two sassy gals with great attitudes that are close friends that will complement the best friend relationship we have.

title: The Blurred Line Between Boredom, and Loneliness
text:
Being a single MAN for a few years, and vowing to never fall in love again (or be able to), I used to think I was just bored, and wanted someone to enjoy casual conversation with, on a come and go basis, as people usually lack the attention spans, to remain connected for "extended periods" a.k.a. more than a few days. I used to think that my days of loving-deeply and passionately-were over, and that I would not miss romantic love, if I just had someone to talk to, and laugh with. Meeting in real life did not even seem important. An email/text/phone conversation, here and there, seemed to be all I needed, to distract me from boredom.

And it worked. Posting here, and making random, , temporary connections, really did break the monotony of my boredom. Put lots of intermittent smiles on my face. And all those disappointments, that I felt, every time a "temporary connection" was lost, had awakened me to the cold reality that I want, need and crave so much more, than a random, temporary distraction. Those are great, in the first few days of getting to know someone, and establishing a connection, but once you do find yourself mentally and emotionally connected with someone, you don't want it to end. You want it to grow stronger. You want that smile to be more than just temporary. You want that connection to grow into what you thought you could never have or feel again. You want that heartwarming emotional connection, that keeps a permanent smile on your face, and keeps your brain craving more and more mental stimulation. in the physical stimulation is important, but fairly easy to get. The greatest form of satisfaction, is the hardest to achieve. When someone dominates your every thought, calms your greatest fears, with a warm embrace, and melts your heart, by simply gazing into your eyes, and speaking those 3 special words- the ones that many of us think we can live without, but often awaken us to our denial, of the fact that we want nothing less, than to love and be loved. Temporary distractions and smiles are great, but a permanent warming of the heart, is such a rare gift, that many of us are not even aware of its existence. Or, in some of our cases. . . Able to believe that we are worthy of feeling it. Again. And again. And again. With every disappointment, another brick is added to our wall, that separates us from the world of feeling, and loving. And every brick that is added to our wall, keeps us more deeply secluded from feeling the best feelings possible. And those feelings still exist behind a complete wall of bricks, but then such feelings are beyond our reach. And we hope that we can live in denial, because the realization of never being able to love and be loved, ever again, is just the most miserably depressing feeling.

I thought I was just bored, and missing entertainment, until I realize that what I really need, is only disguised as a temporary email/text/phone distraction.

Sometimes, the deepest, most romantic, passionate, love can sneak up on us when we least expect it. I used to hope that I never found it again, but now I hope that it finds me-trapped behind this wall of bricks, that has been built up, by every broken heart, disappointment, and betrayal.

Whatever comes of this post, can only be good. Or it can be better. Or the best thing I need in my life. The reality of what I need, has finally set in, but I hope it's not too late. I hope someone has an ax to chop through my wall, or a rope, to scale over it, and save me. I am probably physically able to punch my way through this wall, but I need the inspiration to think there is something good, on the other side, worth fighting for.

Does anyone have an ax, or some climbing equipment?

I'm a SWM aka SINGLE WHITE MAN. 39. Ripped abs, but a torn heart. Physically strong, but emotionally vulnerable. Hysterically funny, but physically drained.
Whatever you are- talk to me. Just to say hello. Just because I am seeking the ultimate, doesn't mean I am avoiding those temporary distractions. Temporary happiness, is better than no happiness, at all.
Throw me a bone, and I'll roll over and play dead like a good dog. maybe you can also use a distraction, and like to play with dogs. 
We are very loyal creatures. and I promise I won't bite.
PS: Did I clearly state the fact that I'm a guy? Tired of getting cock pics and text gibberish.

title: You're all fake as balls
text:
I was doing good for years working from home, going jogging at like 3 in the morning, writing and never talking to a single damn human. Something convinced me to try and interact with people or else I'd die alone and to make real-life friends as that's supposedly a good thing.

Two years have passed and I... I dunno. Am I broken or depressed or just frustrated? I don't know. I started working cafe jobs. I figured if my actual job was to be nice to people, I'd eventually become nice. It works, sometimes. Forcing yourself to laugh does make you happy, right? To a degree, forcing myself to care about people did get me to care. It made me take my job super personally, but even today, I still can't give a shit when someone else starts talking about themselves. In the middle of a conversation, once it's their turn to speak, all I can think is, "Okay, shut up. I need to keep going!"

I work with so many hipsters that say that they themselves hate hipsters. My boss hates the fuck out of me, but I'm the only one that does any work, so she can't show it. If I have a creepy thought or an honest realization, I'll share it... but I'll also share a story of a sweet interaction or a cute joke and that dichotomy makes me seem like a creep if you don't get my sense of humor. I wanna be positive and make people happy, but if a dude takes a cup of boiling water into the bathroom for 15 minutes and comes out without the cup of water, I'm gonna point out that he used that water to wipe his ass... and then I'll tell the story about how I tried to copy him the next day and it spilled and burned the fuck out of my right testicle and inner thigh for days.

My boss never gave me a chance. She always scheduled me opposite of herself since I guess she trusted me to take care of shit when she wasn't there... but in reality, she didn't wanna work with me. The two hours max that we ever worked together, we had nice conversations about all sorts of shit, but fuck that, right? Since then, whenever we have the misfortune of bumping into one another and no matter how good of a mood I'm in, I always walk away from her feeling like a piece of shit. I'll start telling a story and be like, "So, I think I just cost us a new regular customer... There's this new chick at the yoga place next door. She was coming in and chatting with me every morning and after a week or so, I asked her for her number and I got all awkward and paused a lot and now she hasn't been back. She hasn't even passed by to go to work. I think I made her quit her job and move back home." It's meant to be funny and be a segway to talking about the 50+ yr old chick that wants to Netflix and Chill with me that I'm seriously considering, but she just goes, "Why would you do that? Whatever. I'm not gonna be here anymore soon, anyway." Fuck you! Dude, I made us sooooo many regular customers. You don't say a fucking word to anyone, ever. You make the place zero dollars. You're just clean and organized and an asshole that hurts my morale.

I've had coworkers hug me unprovoked and ask me to hang out with them or go to the movies and junk and flake out time and again and make me wonder why the fuck they would do those things. If I invite a person to do something, how the fuck would I ever dare to be the one to cancel? Or then if I initiate a hug just once, ever, I get told, "Don't touch me." Really? You hug me pretty much every day, dude. Hugging never happens ever again.

My frustrations are disgusting me, lately. Why do I care? At the same time, I love my regulars and they always brighten my mood and I get to know who they are as people and they learn a lot about me, but 99.99% of the time, I would never try and make it into more than just a work thing since I'd be afraid to make it weird outside of the cafe and risk them never coming back. I've asked out two customers in 2+ years at two jobs. Both ended up with me texting them and then never seeing or hearing from them ever again. It's gotten so pitiful that my go-to sexual fantasies have gone from making a girl eat my ass in public or having a teen crossdresser slut live in a dog cage at the foot of my bed to just holding hands while walking down the street or imagining myself riding on the subway and having a girl lean her head on my shoulder. title: Mental Illness is a Bitch BUTT...You Are NOT Alone!
text:
About me: I suffer intensely from OCD Anxiety and Depression.
My "intrusive thoughts" are mentally crippling, and my social anxiety keeps me secluded from the world. I awaken, exist and sleep within the confines of a mental prison. I have ONE real, true friend, who lives too far away to ever see, so my "alone time" is 24/7. I've been a dancer for 18 years. It's my only escape and comfort zone, and ironically, I can freely, comfortably glaze in baby oil, and dance on stage at a club before hundreds of watching eyes, BUTTT....outside of my comfort zone of the club, my social anxiety is off the charts. I'm an electrically charismatic performer in front of large crowds, but in intimate one-on-one settings, I'm a pending panic attack! Simply: my life is hopelessly fucked. I'm alone, and worst of all - lonely. It's amazing what one can adapt and get used to.
Does anyone share any aspect of my existence? Anxiety, Depression, PTSD, Schizophrenia, cutting (I've done that), Personality Disorder? Can anyone relate to me, in any way? Know this: YOU ARE NOT ALONE!!! You may think you are, and closed-minded assholes make us feel alone, but we are not. We have one another. And we have to connect and stick together, because realistically, we are all we have.
Don't feel ashamed to admit your issues and illnesses. I will accept and embrace you as you are, and as my friend, you will never feel alone again! My intentions are genuine. I'm too far gone to help myself, so if I can help anyone in any meaningful way, my life will gain some much needed value. That's how I get off - being a friend to those who need one. It may not be a cure, but face it - theres no better medication than friendship! So reach out to me, and I promise to reach back, with a hug, shoulder to cry on, advice, or just a dose of laughter.
SWM here.

title: Because To Be Beautiful Is To KNOW That You Are. . .
text:
Because to be beautiful is to KNOW that you are. . .
And to love everything and everyone that surrounds us unconditionally. . .
Is to genuinely understand that maybe everything we were granted the ability to see. . .
Wasn't designed to be seen as perfect. . .
And the only flaw that there could ever possibly be. . .
Is the judgement we conceive for it. . .
If what they say is "Truth" doesn't harmonize with the music that already lives inside of you...
Then it could never set you free. . .
But if what they speak makes your heart SING. . .
Then you sing with them. . .
As your energy illuminates the sky. . .
And you unconsciously vibrate with positivity...
Bringing inspiration to anything that has a desire to be. . .

-Me :)

title: Too many feel they have to live in fear in order to survive. . .....
text:
....."There's just something about making a choice that free's the mind..... . .Even when the future hold's no certainty. . ....But Just building up the courage to say F%*K IT!... . ..HERE'S WHAT I'M GONNA DO!. . ..HERE'S HOW I'M GONNA DO IT!. . ....AND HERE'S WHAT I'M GONNA BE!. . ...REGARDLESS OF WAY THINGS MAY SEEM. . .... . ..Begins to change everything around you. . .almost Instantly. . ..And ppl willing to give a hand seem to always show up. . .. . .Right on time. . .....
Too many live in Bondage. . ....Too many have given up. . ....Too many feel they have to live in fear in order to survive. . ......So many that its become the norm. . .....Which makes no F&%king sense. . ..
Making those like us. . ...." The Dream Chasers". . ....."The Positive Thinkers" . . ... . .. . .. . ..seem like the "Crazy Ones". . .......
Many say they Believe in God. . ..... but I'm beginning to wonder how many of them actually Trust in God. . ....How many are willing to hand over their dreams... or even problems. . ..and letting him handle the details?????. . .....I wonder... . ..????
And of course we must do our part as well... . ..This isn't about just sitting back and praying everything comes our way easily with no effort. . .. . .cause Honestly. . .....That would actually suck!!!! lol. . ..Because thats not living. . .....
Living is living from that special heart place. . .....finding your Passion. . ..And drowning yourself in it daily..... . .being Kind to everyone we come into contact with. . .....Giving back to those who are less fortunate. . .. . .. Living with an Open heart is key. . .and Singing with it too. . ....Singing melodies that come directly inspired by our soul. . ..As God Handles all of the details. . ....Shaping our destiny... . ..
So Sing as loud as you could. . .....Sing until you can't sing anymore. . ..
Just don't expect everyone else to agree with you. . ....and listen. . .. . .Especially those disconnected from the truth. . .....Still lost. . ....looking for any reason to be negative today. . ...Mad at life for their own mistakes. . ...Yet still feel the need to try and tell you you how to live YOURS. . .....Energy Vampires. . ....Who drain you with their constant fear of everything. . ..Scared of even breathing. . .....F%&k them! We still dreaming. . .....And always will. . .....Destiny Awaits us. . ......"

title: It's about ignoring the bullshit. . .THE NOISE. . .. . .
text: Its not about being positive ALL the time. ...its about ignoring the bullshit. . .THE NOISE. . .. . .keeping in mind the reason why we even woke up today. . ..being grateful that even did. . ..and not letting those "energy vampires" ruin our day. . ....too many distractions. . ..too much sadness where there should be joy. . ..too many who have given up. . ..too many that have lost their way. . ..Too many that say the believe in God. . ..but would never fully trust that no matter what happens. ...everything is going to be ok. . ..We've made it this far. . .Its only fair to ourselves that we keep going. . ..

title: Why Are Hot Women So Attracted to Meat-Headed Assholes?
text:
I've never been jealous of meat headed, alpha males, but it's always dry-humped my brain trying to figure out what their appeal was to women. What gravitates a female - especially a sweet, sexy girl with a great body - to the arrogant, shallow, self serving scum that swagger around, dragging their knuckles, hair greased and gelled into shapes that I haven't seen since 5th grade geometry class? You know the type - metrosexual pretty boys, with egos bigger than their steroided biceps - often adorned with some tattood barbed wire, to signify how bad ass they THINK they are. And if you accidentally brush against one of them in a bar, they will pummel you into a coma. On a date - with the hot girls who crave their company, they will dominate the conversation by telling you all about themselves, and IF you manage to stay awake, and are horny enough to go home with him/it, you will surely have the most intense 5 mins of near pleasure of your life (if you're a virgin - or Amish). And will he call you the next day? Sure, he will call you a "great piece of ass" - to all his neanderthal friends, and if they want a piece of you, they will certainly call - I mean text you, until the restraining order goes through. 
Some of you are laughing at my description, but most of you are somehow attracted to these redundant piles of protoplasm, even if you swear otherwise. You watch Jerksey Shore, and masturbate. Your dog looks away in disgust. Dogs are more selective. You crave such men, as lovers, boyfriends, and even platonic friends. I mean really? Whats the appeal? Interest? Fascination? Intrigue?.... Gag and puke threshold?
Me and your dog slap each other silly when we see an attractive woman who can have any guy she wants, walking arm-in-paw with some meat headed genetic defective. 
Any input?
I'm genuinely intrigued to know why guys like that have their pick and choice of the best looking women, while guys like me have to sit home alone, questioning this shit. And by "guys like me", I mean the intelligent, sweet, sensitive, romantic sacks of mush, who love and respect women for who they are, and if we find one we like - care for ---love, we place them on the highest pedestal and worship their existence. We ask them how their day was, and care to hear all about it, even if the reply is "I had the worst day ever!" We hold hands, hug, kiss, cuddle, and pleasure our women far beyond their wildest fantasies. It's never about us, its always about THEM - physically, mentally and emotionally.
For those of you gagging at my type - oh, well, your loss. I have so much to offer, but no one to offer it to. I'm selfless and sweet to a painful fault. I click best with anyone who can laugh at themselves, at me, and the rest of the world's uptightness. I am the polar opposite of any alpha dick head. But don't get me wrong. I'm not a skinny nerd who can name all the stars in the sky. I'm a muscular nerd who can do that, with my telescope. I'm a dancer, I spend my weekends glazed in baby oil, but.....I dance at a cheezy 80s club, which is nerdy to the 10th degree. And thats the funny part - I've got abs more ripped than the Jerksey Shore ass-clowns, but in every other way, I'm as opposite of them as my posts are to theirs. If you've read the gibberish on this site, you'll agree.
What's the purpose of my post? Bullet points seem to work well in resumes, sooo....
*To find out what attracts women to the assholes
* To find out why my type is like a rabid, measled subway rat with advance-staged cooties to most women
*?????. Maybe I can make a friend, to make life more interesting with. Maybe just a random email chat. Maybe more. Maybe a lot more.
If you've read this far, you already know my basics. If not - shame on you for fast forwarding to the end!! What if I decide to quiz you?!:)
You're welcome for the laugh:)

title: IS THERE ANYONE--JUST ONE PERSON--LONELY OUT THERE TOO? (30-55)
text:
Hi, and thank you for your interest so far. I am about 5'11" tall, average build and work in Manhattan.

I know people have told me not to put too much detail into this post, but I want to begin by being HONEST about my circumstances, what I am looking for, and HOPEFULLY someone out there will have either been in a similar situation, or at least be able to empathize to the point of (I hope) a cup of coffee, at least.

First of all about AGE? Doesnt matter.. all my life was in relationships with my age.. yet last gf was 21 and I am late 50s. We were together as a couple for 3 years. She was tired of guys her age who only wanted her for the physical, then left her. She wanted someone more Mature who would truly take time to get to know her as a person. Someone Older who would listen to her thoughts, feelings, respect, care for her.

And romantically, someone more Mature who would take time for warmth, affection, Tenderness. Someone who would go slow---hold hands, cuddle, be gentle.

That is why it worked.. and why it PROVES when it comes to age it is truly just a number. For feelings are Universal at any age.

So if you are in my age range, fine. But if younger, doesnt matter!

Either way!

OK so that being said, here goes (LOL):

Some time ago I lost many things at once:

1) Girlfriend of 7 years (she broke up);

2) Best male friends of 20 years (they did not die but went their own way)

3) My car

4) My job (D0NT WORRY I have a good job now)

5) And my own place (share for now w/ex wife... purely financial reasons.. she dates.. i date.. 2 separate lives --divorced for 10 years now, can prove it and saving to get OWN place again in 4 months).

Subsequent to all those losses, I did make 1 true friend (platonic) and was in a relationship with a woman for 1-1/2 years, which ended a few months ago (she moved out of NY).

At this point, I am seeking a friend to talk to, to do things with.

I AM SO TIRED of doing everything ALONE.. it HURTS!

Id like to meet a pleasant, warm female companion to share things with.. movies, walks, anything we have in common.

I enjoy bowling, outdoors, LOVE nature.. fresh air, trees, and music.

Love All kinds of music pretty much.. books, movies

But most especially just being with a special person.

It is NOT easy to be ALONE in NY. And despite the fact I have recovered pretty much from what I pointed out in the 5 points above, being alone again now. Just feels empty.. especially around the holidays!

I put this ad in BOTH the platonic section AND the dating section because I am OPEN to both friendship AND romance.

I happen to be a very Affectionate person, love to hug, cuddle? I love it.

Ultimately, I am looking for a woman I can CHERISH, treasure for her mind, heart and soul? a woman who wants a man who will be LOYAL, TRUSTING, who will stand by her no matter what.. who will be her best friend, her soulmate.

A man who she can turn to at all times.. to lean on for strength, emotional support. Who will be tender, gentle, and loving.

If ure looking for that too.. not a man who plays games but a man who can be DEVOTED, WARM, loving, a good listener.. empathic.. im here!

I am college educated, and FIX COMPUTERS on the side.. so if u need any help with your computer, feel free to ask.

OK that's about it. IF you are looking for an older man or a man your age that you can talk to, lean on, who will listen to your feelings or just have fun with, please write me.

All I ask is that if you are interested, to meet for coffee and talk.. that?s all I ask. IN PUBLIC of course so u feel SAFE.. and play it all by ear from there.

In return u would meet a man who:

1) has UNLIMITED LOYALTY

2) has UMLIMITED affection

3) is a good listener

4) is someone u can turn to for support, strength, encouragement

5) will be tender, romantic, sensual, gentle, loyal, just, kind and warm

If interested all I ask is to meet for coffee in public.. that's all I ask.

Hope to hear from you, Norman

P.S. I have a Car if that helps. LOL

do NOT contact me with unsolicited services or offers

title: Desparately seeking conversationalist!
text:
I will be visiting from Boston on Wednesday and Thursday (March 2 and 3) for a series of meetings and I am looking for a dinner companion on Wednesday evening. 
I am wondering if there are any good conversationalists left. By a "good conversationalist", I mean an individual who doesn't talk for 20 minutes without pausing. 
I am an attractive, mid 50s, well-educated professional man looking for a dinner companion between 40 and 60 who is confident and able to carry on a conversation. Among the topics about which I would be pleased to talk would be any of the following: politics, business, sports (especially basketball), working out (I work out daily), music (I play guitar), relationships, foreign culture (I speak a bit of French and Italian), PBS shows (Downton Abby and the like), entrepreneurship, and technological innovation. Not looking for a hook-up!
If you are interested in discussing topics not on my list, hit me up and check out whether it was a topic that I had forgotten to list or I feel incapable of discussing intelligently. 
I'm looking forward to making a new friend in New York!

title: Do You Have Nice Feet? Let's Meet!
text:
Are your feet your best feature? Do you get complimented on your feet. You pamper them, keep them soft and smooth, you paint your nails all kinds of colors to make them look good and get noticed. You know your feet look great. You wear sexy shoes that are a little off the beaten path, and sometimes you dangle your shoe on the tips of your toes hoping to catch that wandering eye.

Alas, a good foot man is hard to find. You long for the guy who will adore your feet as much as you and won't judge you for having a slightly unusual fetish. Your kind of man knows your feet are every bit as sensual as the rest of your body. He wants to lick your soles and instep along with the soft folds of your arches. He wants to suck your toes and slide his tongue in the spaces in between.

I'm a good-looking, fit single white guy. I'd love to suck your toes. If this strikes you as a weird idea, just move on to the next ad. Like I said, I'm an attractive, normal guy hoping there's someone out there that is turned on by the thought of having her toes licked and sucked.

Please, no Pros, or anyone asking for a "donation" or "tribute".

Please reply with "Cute Toes" in the subject line so I know you're a genuine person and not a spammer.

If you've read this far and found yourself wiggling your toes and a tingling feeling in your feet, write me back. We need to chat!

title: SIMPLY PUT - YOU ARE A HORRIBLE PERSON. PART DEUX!
text:
The last we saw each other I asked you " why are you playing games with me? " you coolly replied
" If you don't like my games, don't play them". When you said that it hit me all at once that I was standing with a true sociopath. I was the mouse and you the cat. I walked away that day devastated 
For so many reasons. That I loved you, and foolishly thought that you loved me. I mean who stands
There with tears in their eyes and says I love you without meaning it. You do my green eyed beauty.
Within days of your emotional assault I spiraled out of control. Emotionally, physically and spiritually. Actually contemplating suicide. Over you.

title: Do You Ever Wanna Curse the World and Take a Personal "Time Out"??
text:
Have you ever felt so confused over what you really want the most, in life, that you just curse everything and everyone, and sink into your own personal, indefinite "time out"? You want someone to chat with about random nothingness, but you also want someone with a few brain cells, and an IQ slightly higher than their core body temperature, who you can match wits with. You need someone to fuck you into oblivion, yet you want someone to just cuddle up to, snuggle and melt with. You want someone to love you, unconditionally, yet you get turned on by the venom they spew when they're so mad that they hate you.
I've been in my own personal 'time out' for wayyy too long! I'm sick and tired of being lonely, yet I'm even more tired of trying to impress people in order to make a friend - especially when most friends come & go with the seasons.
Want to experience the world together? Or maybe even just share a 'time out' space and keep each other company? I'm an awesomely charismatic, and adorably cute, funny gem of a sweetheart! You'll love me! What have we got to lose? Besides our lonely, frustrating "time out"?

I saw you on the train. You looked like a prisoner and your captor was your husband. We exchanged glances for a while, and occasionally smiled at each other. We had a connection. You felt the same thing I felt. You needed to escape as much as I did. I prayed that your husband would get off on the next stop and leave you so I could talk to you...but he didn't. We needed each other. We got lost in each other eyes and shared a beautiful, quiet moment. It was the most exciting thing that happened to me in a long time. I wish I could see you again. 

If you read this story and wished that this could happen to you, message me.
