title: Graffiti Guide
text:
Wanted: someone to wander around and look at graff with on Thursday. I like the idea of mostly being in Brooklyn, but I'd really be down to explore wherever. Maybe go up to the Bronx to see the writer's bench? Or take a ride on the N or the 7 and see some of those rooftops.

YOU:
-Are free Thursday.
-Understand that I'm definitely not going to sleep with you.
-Get up. 
-Aren't an asshole. Or a toy.
-Aren't just going to show me your own stuff. I want to see it all.
-Are over 25 and under 40.
-Aren't strung out.

I:
-Don't paint, but it's an important part of my life.
-Am only in town on Thursday,
-Take a lot of pictures.
-Am kind of cute, in an awkward way.
-Am not interested in anything physical.
-Don't mind having to work a little to see the best spots. (I may be short, but I can climb a fence.)

Really, I'm mostly just looking for someone to hang with because I could use some company to take my mind off of other things. But I'd be completely happy exploring on my own, too, so don't get attached to the idea that I need you in order to make my NYC experience complete or something.

title: Simply Put - You Truly Are A Horrible Person!
text:
Alicia,
When we met I wasn't looking for anything from you. I saw you as this younger woman in pain and Scared. My paternal instinct kicked in and foolishly I wanted to save you. But who was going to save me? Save me from your insidious lies and deceit? I opened my heart and mind in ways for you that I had never done before in my life. You disarmed me with your story of pain, and with that smile that could warm the coldest of souls. But the whole thing was a lie. You told me he was a monster, that he verbally abused you, mentally mistreated you. When the rain stopped and I could see clearly through the clouds I saw that it was you who was doing that to him. Him and I came close to hurting each other over you and your lies. You sat on the sideline and acted like a fan cheering all this destruction on. Shame on you! When the whole situation finally finished and we were done with each other, you left me scarred and wounded. You went back to him. You told me you choose him because he is dumb and you can easily manipulate him. That might have been the only truth you ever spoke.
You told me you have never been loved, and that you never had a real friend. I tried so hard to give you both. But know now that you are truly a sociopath and you aren't able to accept not just my love, but anyone's. It scares me that such a intelligent, beautiful, engaging young lady like you actually will continue down the path of trying to hurt other people just for some sick desire you need to feed that hollow soul. I'm a good man who got blinded by your deceit and total deception. Socrates once said the most powerful force is not love, but forgiveness. I cannot forgive you ever. And honestly cannot wish you well.

title: Allow ME to Break Your Monotony of Fake, Shallow, Borrrring Friends?
text:
Like most of you, I'm human. I am 3 dimensional. My mind, heart and body all require equal stimulation.
It seems some people were born/hatched lucky, with happy happy joy joy lives already destined. Such people always have a friend, or 10 to turn to in times of need, a romantic interest to hug & cuddle, and mind blowing, multi-orgasmic sex that they need a full weekend to recover from.
Now MOST of us...were not born so lucky. Most of us are lucky to have just one single aspect of our lives worth smiling about. We fall short because lets face it, some of us really suck as humans, and aren't worthy of total fulfillment. But for those of us who are worthy, because we are actually good hearted, caring, nurturing, selfless sweethearts.....life is a mangy, mongrel of a bitch - in heat, and forever peeing on the couch and carpet (I love dogs, just using the metaphor:).
We don't deserve it, but you know what? I'll tell you what. We can stop waiting for fulfillment to fall into our laps like a pile of food at a picnic or BBQ served on those flimsy paper plates that always collapse the moment we sit down to eat.
Amused by my wit, are ya? Do I seem like someone worth getting to know - at least thru email? Hey, imagine this - if we do get to know each other, something nice...sweet...special...totally freaking magical may happen. POOF! Just like that...it can happen.
Still laughing at me and my idea?....whilst you sit there alone...lonely...deprived and needing something of a magical POOF intervention in your life? Don't knock it until you've tried it! Kinda like anal sex or Karaoke. Or chocolate Nutella on ANYTHING.
I'll go first.
Hello. My name is _______ (its Creepslist, remember). I'm 37 years old, with a warm heart and free spirit. I'm alone, lonely, and sick and tired of being both those things. Id very much like to trade in this shitty deal for something more fulfilling, like ...ANYTHING that involves a mental, emotional and/or physical connection with a sweet, easy going, witty, free-spirited female. Bonus points for goofiness. Agenda: Just go with the flow!! Happiness is not complicated to achieve. It's pretty easy, actually, if you don't try so hard to achieve it. Just....go...with...the...flow....
I'm in muscle-ripped shape, give awesome hugs, kiss passionately, am a friend more loyal than most deserve, and would rather listen to you vent about your shitty day, than talk about my own.
Any age/race for email companionship, or......go with the flow....

title: * PART-TIME ENTREPRENEUR *
text:
Have you ever felt like something was just not right with the world? As if you've been living a lie? If you ever seen The Matrix movies, then you know what I'm talking about.

Not saying that we all live in a computer generated world, but I do believe that metaphorically speaking, we do live in a Matrix. Some of the realities are created by other people, organizations and institutions. . .others are created by our own perception of things.

We've been conditioned to believe that only the 'lucky ones' achieve their dreams. . .that only a chosen few will be able to do what they want, when they want and with whom they want.

I call b.s. on that!

Because I have been awakened and I 'unplugged' from the Matrix, I see the world in abundance instead of lack. Now, are there real-life real-world problems out here? Absolutely! But don't get it twisted. . .we each have the power to make major changes in the world. . .but it starts with empowering ourselves, first and foremost.

With the help of fellow empowering part-time (and full-time) entrepreneurs, I get to impact thousands of people's lives from anywhere I choose as long as I have an internet connection.

If you are still reading this, then you may be the person I'm looking to lock arms with. But before I continue, let's take a trip down memory lane. . .

I was born in D.C., but grew up in Hampton Virginia. Growing up, the focus in my family was to go to school, get good grades, and find a high paying job. Pursing my passions was secondary to making sure I had education that would at least land me a safe and secure job.

You and I both know that there is no such thing as job security. And even if there was such a thing. . .it does not guarantee FINANCIAL security. As I learned in Robert Kiyosaki's book Rich Dad Poor Dad, it's not about how much you make, but how much you KEEP.

But I digress. . .so, through most of my scholastic years, I had been an honor roll student. It wasn't until my freshman year at James Madison University did I experience my first major failure. . .long story short; I got academically suspended and could not return for a calendar year.

I felt like a loser. . .how does one go from an A-B honor student to academic suspension? On the outside looking in, it would appear that the only way it could happen is from me simply not caring at all about my education...and that was far from the truth.

It was a shock to my ego, I'll admit. My friends asked were my parents furious at me because I failed so miserably. It was a surprise (even for me) to find out that they weren't furious at all. Perhaps disappointed, but that is my guess because they never expressed disappointment with me for doing so poorly in college.

But this goes a back to the Matrix thing. . ..my perception was that I was a loser, a failure, and that my parents were disappointed with me. . .all because of the expectations I had set for myself.

Fast-forward to 1996, when I decided to serve in the U.S. Navy after a year off from school and working a part-time job as a dessert prep/dishwasher. 

I basically still owed tuition to JMU as well has had to start paying back on the student loan (which wasn't even enough to cover the full tuition in the first place). Most of my buddies had gone into the service in other branches, so I figured the military couldn't be that bad.

I had a great time in the military; traveling the world, meeting different kinds of people. . .little did I know that this experience planted the seed of traveling as a lifestyle. Some of the places I traveled to were Colombia, Jamaica, Venezuela, Aruba, Germany, England, Denmark, Halifax and many more!

I used the time in the Navy to pay off my student debt as well as learn some skills in advanced electronics. I got honorably discharged after serving six years of service. After serving my time I decided to come back home to Virginia.

In 2002, I began work as a shipbuilder, doing electrician work. In the following years, I went from working outside in the elements to being in a climate-controlled cubicle. You would've thought I had 'made it.'

That was far from the truth.

I was not fulfilled.

I witnessed first-hand the office politics and was not down with it.

I have always been a free-spirited person. I do not do well with rules that don't make sense to me. To blindly do things just because 'they said so' never flew with me...especially when I found better ways of doing things.

I soon realized that just because it makes sense, doesn't necessarily mean that we're doing it that way. . .it seemed as if less things made more sense, the more we did them.

Have you had this experience at your job? If so, then you can feel my pain, lol.

It wasn't until after reading Rich Dad Poor Dad in 2007 did the "entrepreneurial bug" bit me. I knew there was more to life than working the 40-40-40 Plan (40 hours a week, for 40 years only to get a retirement check 40% of what I'm making now. . .which wasn't enough in the first place), but did not know exactly how to go about looking.

Reading that book opened my eyes to how the money game actually works. I found out why the rich get richer, the poor get poorer and why the middle-class is getting wiped out.

I made a DECISION to make a change.

It was time to let go of the old ways of thinking I had adopted from my elders (no fault of theirs. . .they didn't know what they didn't know and did the best they could with what they had, and I thank them for it).

After a brief dabble into real estate investing, I got introduced to the home based business industry. . .I've been hooked ever since. Now, it didn't come without challenges; and I've had my fair share. 

To name a few:
-I racked up over $70,000 in debt
-I lost my home to foreclosure
-I got my car repossessed twice in a year
-I got my lights shut off every 3 months for a year

As you can see, even though I was making decent money, I wasn't keeping much of it. A lot of it went to over-draft fees, late fees, living beyond my means via credit cards, etc.

I was pretty reckless with my money. I'm sure you know a couple of folks who've been reckless with their funds as well.

There are a lot of things I want to do. I have dreams of becoming financially free; to travel the world and learn different cultures; to take cruises and spend days on the beaches of the world under blue skies and palm trees.

I want to create MY OWN economy without having to depend on a job to do these things. . .and I don't want to have to wait 40 years to save up, only to have the freedom, but not the body to enjoy my freedom, if you know what I mean, lol.

And the best part of creating wealth is the ability to give more. I'm not breaking the bank (yet) but I have tasted what I felt like to earn income leveraging the internet in a way that I don't have to be present for every transaction.

I am building a business while having a life!

I'm not ashamed to say that I currently still work my 9-5, because I know that if my company were to let me go that I already have something in place working for me on my behalf (even as I type this message you're reading).

To have that peace of mind is priceless! I can now go to work without the stress. . .I can deal with the politics because I know that these shenanigans are temporary.

If you want to know more about my challenges and how I overcame them, feel free to add me as a friend on FB; holla at me:
https://www.facebook.com/valentinocrawford

Send me a message and tell me what YOUR DREAMS are and how making an extra income online will help you and your family.

I do read all of my FB messages because I do care. . .but I cannot want something for you more than yourself. I'm not the type to think I'm too good to answer messages. I was once in your shoes and I remember where I came from.

Your future self and your dreams are waiting for you; when will you make a decision meet up with them?

Peace,
~Valentino
https://www.facebook.com/valentinocrawford

title: TAPAS and Sangria tonight?
text:
It's been a while since I've been to Spain. Almost 3 years, but its impression on me is still fresh and unequivocally beautiful. From Gaudi's artwork, hanging out on Las Ramblas, enjoying Serrano Ham at the Museo de Jamon, endless sangria and red, red wine.

Let's not forget being part of La Marcha, eating around 10 or 11 after a well-deserved nap, and staying out all night -- drinking, dancing, flirting, laughing and just seeing where the wind blows.

Most of all, I miss the attitude of the Spaniards, to smile a little too much, dress like you're always going to a party, and especially joking about anything and everything under the sun.

All in all, maybe you're a sassy, smart chica who misses the Spanish lifestyle, or just a cosmopolitan woman looking for a well-traveled, well-dressed, 5'10, 170lbs, jet-black haired, native New Yorker to have a night out on the town with, do look me up.

We can get together at one of the many bars I know with red walls and real sangria, get our fingers a little greasy with a couple of small plates, you can tell me about the last concert you went to or a book that's captured your imagination. Let's enjoy the art of communion by dim lighting.

If my ad has piqued your interest, feel free to say hola or que tal and tell me what you love about Spain, your favorite places to go dancing in the city and of course include a picture or 3 (including a full length) and I'll be happy to reciprocate. I'm free after 8pm tonight let's go enjoy some amazing food...

For now I'll say Chau, and look forward to making your acquaintance.

title: 4 HANDS MASSAGE- AMAZING
text:
4 Handed Massage The Ultimate Experience!
That's right, 4 hands, 2 MALE therapists and 1 body (yours) if you have not had this amazing experience, you are missing out on something special. This makes a perfect gift!!!
A 4 handed massage is a truly wonderful and soothing experience with two different sensations happening at the same time your body and mind won't know what sensation to focus on. This allows your mind and body to go even deeper into a meditative state of bliss.
What is a Tandem or 4 -- handed massage?
Definition: Four-handed massage is a massage where two therapists work on you at the same time, mirroring each others' movements. For instance, both your legs or arms are being massaged at the same time. One therapist works on the right side of your back while the other works on the left. Or one may start at your shoulders and neck while the other therapist may start with a foot massage. . .ahhhh!
When done well, your two therapists are working simultaneously, creating a choreographed dance on your back, legs, neck and your entire body. Originating from the ancient Ayurvedic Philosophy, this Quantum Massage experience is a must have for the experienced client as well as those wanting to indulge in an unforgettable journey in massage.

title: Help EMT recover from job loss
text:
Read my story here on how Transcare abruptly filed for chapter 7 bankruptcy leaving me and over 700 other emts JOBLESS. Please support and help wherever whenever you can. Thanks so much.

On Wednesday February 24, 2016 I received an email from my job, a private ambulance company called Transcare saying that it had filed for chapter 7 bankruptcy. The email stated that one of the senior leaders decided to cease funding, as well as the company losing contracts with major hospitals and that the assets of TransCare would be in a court appointed trustee. Basically, the company was no longer. It was being shut down. It was an abrupt notice with no prior warning or plan for the former employees who included both EMT's such as myself and paramedics. When I called in shortly after receiving the email (on 2/24/16) I was told to still come in for my next scheduled shift and that the company at that time had not immediately ceased all operations. When I called in the next day Thursday morning 2/25/16 to inquire about picking up my paycheck, I was told that checks would be distributed the next day, Friday morning at 10am. I got a call from a coworker Thursday night telling me that she was at the base and that management informed employees there, that checks would not be distributed due to a seize of the company's funds. And that at midnight assets including the ambulances were being repossessed. It was a huge blow to come into the base the next day and see everything locked...phone lines disconnected and no ambulances in sight. No word on when and if we were getting our pay checks for that week and the following week. I worked overtime along with dozens of others the previous week to save money for my own personal issues. And to just suddenly come into work and see no one there, and everything locked up was a major blow. It was devastating. I had no answers, no prior warning, no nothing. I'm currently filing a complaint with the Attorney General's office and trying to make others aware of this major impact not only to the employees such as myself who work hard to deliver superb service, professionalism and compassion and respect, but also to the community. I have to survive like everyone else. I have to and will do the best I can to support myself financially. I have already put in other job applications and just awaiting responses. Being an EMT for me was not just a job. It was, and is still my career.

title: Whenever you have the choice whether to be right or to be kind....
text:
"Whenever you have the choice whether to be right or to be kind, always choose kind. Remember you have that choice in all of your daily interactions. And this one KEY of being kind rather than right, in any interaction that you have, will do more for transforming your life, then any course you could ever take, or any book that you could ever read, or any CD that you could ever listen to. Be kind, and give up your need to be right."-Wayne Dyer 



Forgive yourself for your transgressions. See that mistakes are lessons for you to transcend. Release yourself from the tyranny of self incrimination, make the decision to be free. Everything that's ever happen to you in your life, has happened for a reason, and when you are filled with an absence of self forgiveness, and your full of recriminations about what you did or shouldn't have done, or what you should have done. All of these kinds of things are really a message that your sending to the universe saying "God's plan doesn't work, and mine does", that's really an insidious thing to say. Everything that you done or experienced is over, and you had something to learn from it. So forgive yourself and move on with your life."-Wayne Dyer

title: Martinis and Plush Seating on the LOWER EAST SIDE?
text:
After a long day of working at home, I just want to chill and have some great conversation.. I bet you do as well.. so why don't you join me for some flirty, fun conversation on the LES...

It's my favorite neighborhood with it's bohemian feel, delicious yet inexpensive eateries, mosaic of the most creative and musically intuned people. I love it and, fortunately, I've had the chance to see it grow from slums to trendy and comforting.

If you live in the neighborhood or would like a tour sometime or maybe get lost (as there are sidewalks that I'm sure I haven't walked as yet) drop me a note. Let's get into some trouble, eat til our gluttonous appetites are fulfilled, fill our ears with indie vibe or hip-hop bumping, our eyes with films from a foreign tongue..

title: Armed Combat Training For Actors/Actresses/Models/Film Makers/Etc*READ
text:
Are you an Actor/Actress looking for better/more serious roles? Are you looking for more action roles but not being taken serious due to lack of experience?
Maybe you have experience but would like to broaden or sharpen your skill sets.
Or maybe you don't even have experience in acting but you want your opportunity.

Look no further.
*** On top of Self Defense, Fitness, Martial Arts and Defensive Driving, UCE also specialized in Training Actors & Actresses for Action sequences. We can help you hone in on your roles' true potential while getting you prepared physically, mentally & emotionally. 

If You are;
~Taking or wanting to take any various Military/Police/Mercenary/Assassin role/etc? We can provide all forms of various levels in combat military training to reach the desired goal of yourself or the film. With various Weapons training programs, Military Tactics and movement, also Equipment usage. (Get trained by a Special Forces Marine)

~Taking or wanting to take a role with basic or advanced fighting? We can provide different forms of Basic to Advanced Martial Arts to suit your needs & abilities (Develop different fighting skills that suit you from a World Champion in Tae Kwon Do & Master of Various Martial Arts)

~Taking or wanting to take a role where the character's life is very far from yours or your experience & you would like authentic training in emotes & how to act/move/fight/etc? We can provide that as well with most manner of characters anywhere from human, savages, animalistic, to robotic & alien characters to maintain to continuity in the film you are in & the role you are playing or desire to play in the future. (Learn from an experienced Method Actor & Film Scene Combatant)

We can work with any genre that requires an authentic character, which is majority of them- Action, Horror, Sci-Fi, Thriller/Suspense/Documentaries/Special Interests/Drama 
*Also you Don't need a current or upcoming film project to decide to take training. Take it to increase your personal skill base.*

But we do more than just that
***If you are a Director/Writer making a film or you desire to create a film, your characters need to be authentic. Maybe you are having trouble designing certain characters due to lack of experience in the area you are creating. Maybe you are creating a new alien character and you want to design its movements and characteristics to be authentic to the world you've created.

~We can help Directors/Writers cultivate their characters into believable creations
(Get help from a Concept Designer who can make your visions into reality)
~We can help you choreograph your action scenes/fight scenes
(Work with our trainer to find the right desired authentic feel for your Script/Film)
~Also provide your films Actors & Actresses with specialized training
(Not only will they take you & your project more seriously but they will become more envolved with their potential characters)
~Acquire authentic props for you films

Prices are very versatile & adjustable to all film budgets or personal financial situations, reply with what you need & we can help you with a quote that is affordable for anyone. You don't need a lot of money/large film budget to acquire the kinds of training you'd like to receive or have available for your film/script. Small budget/indie films can have just as an authentic feel as the real thing & we can work well with a small budget project to have affordable action in your film to boost the production value. We can work with those with no film budget *Discounts available for special projects* 
Also by providing free training for your Actors/Actresses can help you budget pay better specially with the offer of free training to the acting team.

We have all seen the tons of films No matter the film quality, with Actors/Actresses not seeming real/authentic on set & on camera as they try to portray something they might not fully understand yet.
Don't let your Film or someone else's film suffer because of it, simply talk to us and get the specialized film training you need or design the perfect character for your film, add the Specialized Training you received on your Acting Resume & they would have t choose you. Or add the option of providing specialized training for your film to your Actors/Actresses to get them more involved in your project while becoming the role you envisioned.

title: Handle chores for Her
text:
They are chilling for now after an exhausting day
and are interested in a servant or errand boy type who is 
willingly and reliably committed to handle some chores.
Nothing complicated.

NO ABUSE. NO GAMES.

You're either in a secure enough
position to tackle any nominal costs -
nothing excessive unless you enjoy it
(this is a mutual understanding)
OR 
you will speak up in FIRST reply
so that you may be directed to handle
chores which will be at no cost to you.

If you don't get that this is about 
respect and lifestyle,
and we'd never give you the power
to need what you're offering,
then you don't get us.

This is understood as mutual by the guy who gets it.
You're offering to assist because you enjoy serving a woman.

While this post is not for everyone - just like most ads -
if it's right for you, you know it. It's uncomplicated.

Keep it simple and drama-free.
Listen and absorb basic instructions.
Be committed and resourceful to followup.
Ask questions or request clear instruction
if you're less than sure regarding what you
must get done and are committed to get it done.

It's the strictly platonic section
defined as nonromantic, just friends, nonsexual,
so please no crude or rude suggestions.

You're responding because you're committed to assist with
a round or more of chores, not because you're idly curious or nosey.
Feeling entitled to know a stranger's business doesn't make it so.
Your own life and what works for your life is your business.
Anything other contact is unsolicited harassment and invasion of privacy.

Please include your email, cellular number, location
and available hours to followthrough.

If the foregoing basic information is not included
it will be presumed that you're either less than sincere
or insufficiently focused to make this efficient and easy,
in which case this will tell us that we are not a good fit.

In order to relatively assure that you are sincere,
a fine in the form of a tribute will be applied IF you respond to the ad to assist
but don't followthrough as agreed herein. This is meant to weed out anyone
who is seeking to waste time being duplicitous.

Any reply other than a commitment to effficiently followthrough
on the request of the ad will be perceived as an unsolicited reply
in violation of CL TOU and will be forwarded to Legal and Admin Dept for review.

Let's get the beauty started!!! :)
Willingness to handle some additional basic chores, a plus.

Thank you.

title: A foreign born gentleman ISO a foreign born lady
text:
A foreign born gentleman ISO a foreign born lady or a veteran US Peace Corp Volunteer
Despite many years in US ( almost 30 years), I still carry the charm of old country where people say that if know a man from my region of my country you already have a real and loyal friend!!! 
A transplant expat from the easternmost part of Romania, I lived in Houston Texas, New York and Boston. My accent still lingers on, notwithstanding the best accent reduction efforts, thickness of which in the ears of the beholders/listeners. Actually I spent most of my life in US and I think that I am a regular American guy who simply attended a high school abroad.
Still, I simply feel deeper connection and I feel more at home with foreign --born ladies on the average, no disrespect for American-born ladies. Also, with ladies who were born in US but belong to any ethnic group (Native Americans, Asians, Latino and so on ). Again no disrespect whatsoever to 100% Apple pie ladies. In fact, an American lady who lived many years overseas and who would have guts and courage to date a foreign --born guy like me would be a good match too. Have you gone to Upper Volta as a Peace corps volunteer or have u been stationed long time oversees on one of US military bases ? Foreign born ladies know at least what the real life is about, more feminine, modest and have better manners to the boot.
I do apologize if I might have rubbed the wrong way somebody, no offence intended.
I am a information scientist/metadata creator , plz google OCLC , at least u will have some idea if u are curious about my profession. 
If you are looking for a guy who is well-educated I may well fit your bill. I attended 6 colleges/universities (2 undergrad/4 grad schools and applying for 7th) in NYC, Boston, and oversees. In addition to be born abroad, I have lived in several countries and I speak many languages ( member of Chinese, Japanese, Russian, French, Spanish, Hebrew, German Italian and other languages clubs). 

A member of many cultural institutions (Lincoln Center, Metropolitan Museum, Natural History Museum, Carnegie Hall and other- this is just a fraction ), I am a passionate opera aficionado ( also classical music, museums and arts in general ). I also have a passion for rare/antiquarian books printed in Latin/Greek and other languages, rare coins, stamps, and I attend rare/antiquarian books and coins shows/trade fairs in NYC and other cities on a regular basis (next January 5 at NYC)
I skip other interests like independent films, off- Broadway shows, travel, gym, bike, hike, yoga and other bla-bla-bla yadda (everyone has them).


But Plz, don't consider me to be a high-brow sophisticated snob-- I am very simple, uncomplicated, down-to-earth, honest, sincere, spiritual and guy looking for my best friend and soul mate. 
I am a guy who shovel snow from the doorway for an elderly lady without being asked, who always offers a seat to women when using public transit, who attends New York Cares events (and volunteers to read to visually impaired) , and bring fresh cookie to the office for holidays. I like to help orphans and people with disabilities, and I feel more at home serving meals at homeless shelter (and scrubbing shelter floor as a volunteer ) than wearing a tuxedo/bowtie at a fund-raiser gala. 

I don't care about looks but I am looking for inner beauty, mutual chemistry and intellectual attraction. Yes ladies -- inner beauty. I am an old school romantic with integrity, values and manners. You will be treated and loved as a queen with love , care and affection. I may belong to the endangered species well doomed to extinction, but the last of the Mohegans will live up to the chivalrous principals till the end.
I am a very good ACTIVE listener who is not easily bored with ur problems, good tempered, outrageously funny with wry sense of humor, unassuming and humble ( and humble not just by NYC standards), peaceful, patient, quiet, non-judgmental, mellow , easy-going and laid- back guy, who also with both feet on the ground. I may be blunt but not to the point of disrespect. You can confide in me better than in all ur female friends taken together--I don't gossip and tittle-tattle. 
Not a smoker, no pets (I welcome yours--I am not allergic, unless it is an alligator ) and very health-conscious. On a side, I am an amateur cook who knows a secret recipe that may well change your life . If you like karaoke I can sidekick you and we will sing in duet. Plz google John Bachelor show , it is my favorite and says volumes .
Let's start as strictly platonic friends and look how it will go on, who knows-- sky is limit. In conclusion, it is not so hard to imagine me as ur soul mate, and even more.
PLZ write me back with FRIEND in a subject line, I know u are not a robot or spam , I don't respond otherwise, I have zero-tolerance for head games.PLZ DON'T SEND LEWD PICTURES, DON'T WASTE UR AND MINE TIME, I CAN FIND MUCH BETTER- I more interested in the size of ur brain than in all other sizes.
I DON'T RESPOND TO ONE -LINERS, I WANT TO SEE YOU ARE A SERIOUS AND genuine LADY and not a bot ( put age or approximate age group and so on ). Photo is appreciated ( plz have online) to know that you in my age group ( I mean u are real woman , not a bot or a teenage girl from China who just wants to practice English or a trans-gender man who fantasizes that he is woman.)
Thank you in advance for reading my rather detailed ad and have a wonderful day.

title: 58 Random Acts Of Kindness
text:
The winter months can get people into a rut, but no matter what time of the year it is, random acts of kindness can benefit everyone. 

Random acts of kindness are great for the soul and positively impact others. 

Whether the gesture is big or small, every act can go a long way. The smallest gesture can make someone's day and completely change how they are feeling!

Here's a long and wonderful list of ways to carry out random acts of kindness.

1. Smile and say hello to everyone you cross paths with. I do this with everyone I see and it's always great when someone does it back.

2. Hold the door open for someone.

3. Donate items from your home.Another thing you could do is donate an item for each item you bring home. So, each time you buy a shirt, donate a shirt!

4. Do a chore that you normally don't do for your spouse. This could include doing the dishes, taking out the trash, cleaning your home, making a meal, dealing with a bill, and so on.

5. Donate blood.

6. Bring a trash bag on a walk and collect any trash that you may come across.

7. If someone is spreading gossip,say something nice about that person instead.

8. Give your new neighbors a welcoming gift. This doesn't have to be expensive, dessert is usually loved or you could even just introduce yourself.

9. Leave a big tip. Leave a nice note on the receipt as well.

10. Leave coupons on items at the grocery store for others to use.

11. Bring food to share at work. Everyone loves donuts in the morning.

12. If you have a wedding or a party,donate your decorations and flowers to a hospital or a nursing home afterwards.

13. Send someone flowers for no reason.

14. Send a care package to someone who is away. This could be a person who is working far away, in the military, in college, and so on.

15. Compliment others. A simple "your hair looks great!" can make someone's day.

16. Help someone find a job.

17. Bake treats for animals. Pets at shelters would love to have treats!1

18. Call someone you love.

19. Forgive someone for a mistake.People make mistakes. Maybe you won't forget, but you possibly can forgive.

20. Foster an animal. If you're able to, possibly adopt as well.

21. Rake your neighbor's leaves.

22. If it's pouring out, let someone under your umbrella if you know you're going to the same place. This could apply if you are walking to the inside of a mall from a parking lot, to class from a parking lot, and so on.

23. Encourage someone who is struggling.

24. Pay for someone's bill. This may mean paying for someone's food, coffee, toll, groceries, or something else.

25. Leave post-it notes with positive phrases in public bathrooms.

26. Become a Big Brother or a Big Sister.

27. Help someone in need.

28. Start couponing so that you can donate items at no cost to you.

29. Help a coworker who is having a hard time. You never know what someone is dealing with outside of work.

30. Carry someone's groceries.

31. Donate books that you don't need anymore. You can donate to libraries, hospitals, and more.

32. Spend some time on Free Rice. For each answer that you get correct, the website donates 10 grains of rice through the World Food Program to help end hunger. Plus, it's free to play!1

33. Donate your hair. There are several options for doing this.

34. Let someone check out before you in the grocery store line. They may be in a bigger rush than you.

35. Offer to help someone move.Yes, offer before they even ask you!

36. See how you can volunteer at a nursing home. You could make a new friend!

37. Cook someone a meal. Whether a friend just had a baby or if you know someone who is having a hard time, cooking a meal can mean a lot to someone.

38. Plan a surprise vacation for someone you love. This could be for your parents, your spouse, your children, friends, etc.

39. Become an organ donor. Check yes next time you're getting your driver's license.

40. Volunteer somewhere. The options are endless and there are plenty of volunteer-related random acts of kindness.

41. Register to donate bone marrow.

42. Tell someone's boss that they have a great employee. Usually retail and restaurant managers only hear bad things, so going out of your way to say something good is always great to hear.

43. Check in on elderly neighbors when it's very hot or very cold outside. You never know if their AC or heater may be broken.

44. Help someone who is being bullied.

45. Sponsor a family or buy gifts for the less fortunate for the holidays. I have a friend who has a family tradition of sponsoring a family every December. Everyone in the family pitches in so that another family can enjoy the holidays as well.

46. Give someone a HUGE hug.

47. Tell someone that you love them.

48. Put a nickel, dime, etc. in an expired meter that someone is parked at.

49. Loan money to someone on Kiva. Kiva is a non-profit where you can lend money to low-income entrepreneurs in 82 countries. You can start with as low as $25!

50. Send someone a hand-written letter in the mail. Taking the time to do this can go a long way.

51. Donate money to your favorite cause.

52. Give your seat up to someone else. 

53. Invite someone who is feeling lonely over for the holidays.

54. Create ready-to-go-bags for the less fortunate that you come across. You can help the homeless by filling a bag with a small bottle of water, a quick snack such as raisins, gloves, toothpaste, a toothbrush, small packets of dog food (their dogs are hungry too!), and more.

55. Hold the elevator for someone else. 
Too many have the habit of pressing the close button several times in order to avoid this.

56. Try any of these found here.

57. Babysit someone's children for free.

58. Let others be kind to you. People love to feel needed.

title: Looking To Make A New Friend, Is It You?
text:
Hey there, I am not sure what to really say other than I am looking to make a new friend. The start of this year has been a wild ride with hard turns and rough edges. Happy to say that is no longer the case but we have a full year to go. I guess I am what you would consider a 'nerd', although I lack the social awkwardness and shyness many people seem to assume. I am a writer, filmmaker and if I have some spare time, play video games. I have a lot of interests and more than one hobby. I like to find ways to educate and nourish my mind. During the late night or weekends, I love to go out, whether if it is a party, rave, or just a low key hang out in the city. Don't get me wrong, I love stay ins as well for what is better than doing what you want from the comfort of your own home, right? Several pet peeves of mine is that I seriously don't like stuck up and pretentious people. I especially don't like ignorant people who are insensitive to the lives of other people and who are shallow. I spend a lot of my time volunteering, helping students in my school as well as help my friends succeed in whatever path they choose. Getting to know me is very simple for I believe in just being yourself and saying what it is that is on your mind. People regard me as a leader who is always considerate and doing for others. Loyalty is one of my biggest traits. when I say I have your back, I do, and nothing would change that unless that person crossed me. Lately, I have become fed with the lies and drama people have brought into my life and have removed myself from it all. Now I want to give this whole thing another shot and meet someone who wants something more like I do. Someone who isn't caught up in all the drama and games people play. Someone who wants to move their life forward and have a fun time doing it. Anyways, I feel like I have written more than what I was planning to. If you want to get to know me, send me an email and let's start from there. I will answer any questions you may have and will look forward to your response. 

P.S. If you are a Walking Dead fan, you get bonus brownie points

title: I think my coworker is gay and likes me, but I'm not interested?
text:
I got a new job a few months ago and so far I really like it. One of my coworkers is a nice guy who I became friends with quickly. The thing is, I'm pretty sure he's gay and has a crush on me, but I'm straight, not interested and not sure how to tell him. 

My evidence? He always sits really close to me. He always compliments me. He's always touching my hand and my back. He gives me really long hugs. I'm always catching him staring at me. He talks to me in a flirty way. At first I was flattered that someone was into me because I never get that kind of treatment from women, but after a while it starts to get creepy and uncomfortable. He's a really nice, friendly guy and we have a lot in common and I don't want to ruin our friendship. I feel like it would be awkward telling him straight out and I don't want to embarrass him. How do I quietly and subtly let him know that I'm not interested and make him stop without ruining our friendship?

title: Help crossdressing so I can go to LGBT bars with divorced gay friend?
text:
Okay, first of all, I want to start off by saying that I'm going to go on about a bunch of things that I need. But instead of starting with that at the beginning, I figured I'd start with what I can help you with, so you don't think I'm asking for all this help for free. I'm a web developer and part owner for a startup company, so I don't have a ton of money (until we get bought out and I become a millionaire... any day now!) We happen to have access to a bunch of unused credits at various online services, that I have the authority to use for whatever purpose I want. So I can design and host a professional-looking website for you, if you have a company that needs one. Now that is a service that doesn't normally come cheap! For another company that sells women's shoes, I have access to at least $200 worth of credits. (Too bad they almost never sell shoes in my size.) So I do have a lot to offer myself.

As far as the title, did you get any of that? Basically, my roommate's now ex-husband, who had been with him for two and half years, just left him for another guy, and he's been really down about it, obviously. He needs some time to heal right now, but he has no idea what to do when he's ready to start dating again. I guess he met his ex in their home country, and doesn't have any idea how to meet other gay men here in NYC. I can't imagine it's extremely difficult, but going out to clubs or wherever is always harder by yourself. So I agreed to go with him, but I thought dressing up as a girl would be more entertaining than just having guys hit on me all night and then wonder what the hell I'm doing at a gay bar if I'm straight. I already have long hair and pierced ears, I can fit into women's clothes that aren't plus sizes, plus I've watched a bunch of YouTube makeup tutorials. I've gotten pretty far, to the point where I think I'd feel confident enough in the way I look to go out in a group. But some things you just can't learn from tutorials. Like, whenever I put on makeup, I always look sad. How do I fix that!? It's hard to learn in a matter of weeks or months, what most women have been practicing their whole lives. Not to mention, there's a few extra steps when guys do it.

Also, my hair is too long to style easily, and I have three years worth of accumulated split ends. I need about 6-8 inches taken off, probably just past my shoulders, but left in a really versatile style that would look appropriate on a guy just waking up, that could be pulled back easily enough, and of course, that left me with a bunch of more feminine styling options if I so chose. So I kind of need help getting my hair cut, whether you do it, or know someone who would understand what I needed ahead of time and wouldn't make me feel awkward. I've had too many miscommunications with people who have cut my hair. I spent three years growing it out and am terrified of getting a bad or too-masculine haircut, or a haircut that's too short to pull back. Incidentally, I have a lot of hair on my head, and it's quite thick. 

Might be nice too, if we could trade clothes and makeup. (Not to sound racist, but it'd be cool if your complexion was somewhere near Covergirl Buff Beige. :p) Apparently I'm a size 8-16 depending on the brand (though most often a size 10 for jeans and skirts, size 12 for dresses), and am size S-XL (M and L fit me about equally as often), or one size up or down depending on the fit). Also, if you could randomly take afternoons off with me and go clothes shopping at thrift stores, that'd be awesome! Clothes for both of us, of course. If you have any experience with sewing, I just bought a cheap compact sewing machine recently, and could use some help learning how to make alterations. Also, I've been researching how they make fatsuits and such for theaters. Let's just say, my hips DO lie, and I'd like it if they were better at lying.

Really though, what I want most of all is just a friend to do all this stuff with, who will help me get over my fear of going out in public in a dress, towering over everyone with my heels. My roommate needs his space right now, and spending that much time by myself makes me feel like I'm isolating myself from the world. Granted, I work ridiculous hours for not a ton of pay, but the nice thing about being part-owner of a company is that you can set your own hours, so I can nearly always make myself available if I need to. I really need to do more on the weekends though, so I hope you have those days off too. I am single, straight, and not bad-looking (kind of pretty actually), and I'm open to a relationship, but mostly looking for a friend. I'm kind of weird, interested in almost everything, and will talk your ear off about biochemistry, history, geology, or any of a number of subjects if you let me. I have a ton of different skills, especially in the realm of building stuff and fixing stuff. Someone once told me the song "No Handlebars" reminded her of me, because I was the only one she knew that she thought could probably do all the things in the song. (Google "flobots no handlebars" if you haven't heard it.) People who know me might describe me as argumentative, but really my life's goal is understanding the true nature of the universe, so if someone is propagating information that I know is false, I sometimes can't let that stand. I will readily admit when I'm wrong though, and like being proven wrong. It means I've learned something new! I mostly wear jeans and t-shirts as a guy. One of the perks of being a web developer. It's great, because if I get a hole in a pair of dress pants, I usually just have to get rid of them. A hole in a pair of jeans though; who knows? They could have come like that new. My taste in women's clothes tends towards the classy. None of that Vegas showgirl-type silliness.

So if you want to make a new weird friend (possibly two, if you'd like to go out to LGBT-catering bars with my divorced friend and I) or think it's fun dressing up guys as girls, and think you're able to help me feel more comfortable about who I am, please tell me enough about yourself that I can tell whether you're interesting and whether you'd be able to help me. Like not the typical Craigslist one-sentence response. I promise I'll reply to any serious emails with a response at least as long as you write me.
interests: Chemistry, biology, building things, programming, and whatever else happens to fit in this field. Oh? I can keep going? Well, sewing lately, although I need some ideas for projects. Most things technical or scientific. Philosophy, writin

title: Computer musician stoner guy in Seattle seeking new friends for email/
text:
Hi there. Have you thought about moving to the PNW? Or maybe you're just bored and want a new friend to exchange emails with. Whatever the case may be, I'm available for email or chat. Please only respond if you're going to take the time to write a decent response; no one-liners please. I appreciate well-written letters and I tend to get along with creative/intellectual types. I have been missing that type of connection lately.

So, being that I live in Seattle, you may have me somewhat figured out. I smoke weed, I drink coffee, I work in technology, and I'm progressive. I have LGBT friends and family. So, we may not mesh well if you're religious or conservative, though I'm open for debating stuff if that's your thing.

I work in IT for a popular retail company. As I mentioned, I work a night shift which leaves me fairly isolated, however I only work 3-4 nights a week, so that's nice because it allows me time to work on music and do other productive things like play video games and watch movies. I like working nights, being awake at night. It's peaceful and sort of like a whole different world. I do stay up until around noon, so it's not like I don't get to see daylight ever, but this schedule does not seem conducive to making new friends.

I play and record guitar, bass, synths, drums, and vocals. I don't have a band right now, but I'm hoping to put one together soon, and I'm hoping that playing my music live will help with meeting people. My music is sort of indie rock with some electronica. My musical tastes range from jazz like Ella Fitzgerald and Miles Davis, to bands like Tool and Radiohead. I was raised on The Beatles, Paul Simon, Billy Joel, Abba, classic rock. One of my favorite 'contemporary' bands is Pinback.

I like getting out and about when I can. There are so many great, beautiful places around Seattle to explore, hike, go camping, etc. I also enjoy traveling when I get the chance. I have been to Canada and Scotland and I'd like to visit many more places, take your pick.

I'm getting back into shape and I feel pretty good about it. I have a home gym where I work out about every other day. I'm also eating healthier; lots of vegetables and fewer carbs/sugar. I'm growing my own garden this year, too, so I'm excited about that.

So, yeah, that's a little about me, now how about you? Feel free to ask me anything, too. I look forward to hearing from you (ʘ‿ʘ)

title: laid back
text: i am in my late 20s, I am a single white male, i enjoy helping people and making others laugh. I have had a difficult life, I have always had to "make the best of it" I stay positive and believe that good things are coming, I am so close, maybe only a week away. After years of working minimum wage jobs I finally got a chance to do something with my life. Last week I started working this incredible job, I can't tell you how overwhelmed with enthusiasm I am. You go through life trying to stand tall and crack smiles, nobody said it was easy. I'm not complaining, I am a very humble handsome modest jack of all trades. The one thing I do most is helping other people, maybe so much that I have forgotten to look after myself. I need an incredible favor from a stranger in New York City. I know I won't get any responses and I will "make the best of it" certainly not hold it against anybody. I need a place to crash starting tomorrow until Friday the very latest, thursday night the latest. I am not asking for much, I'd sleep on the floor, in the doorway. I know it sounds ridiculous, it can't hurt to ask, you never know. I have lived with many women in the past, nothing in recent years. I haven't hooked up with anyone in a long time and I am not going to try now. In fact I've almost accepted that it will never happen again and I am okay with it. I know if I keep doing the right thing, the rest will come later. I will cook, clean, fold laundry, assemble ikea furniture, brew coffee anything to help out. I know its super aggressive, if anything I hope whoever reads this gets a good laugh.

title: had a pretty bad day today
text:
i'm really a pretty happy optimistic person and most of my life is going pretty well. but to be honest, today hit a new low in terms of my social life, particularly with regard to dealing with dudes. it's already hard enough once you hit 35 or so when all your guy friends are married, coupled up, having kids, etc. but trying to be in a relationship with a dude is very tough and i dont think guys really want to commit or even know what they want. today i realized the one dude i could really count on not to bullshit me was not being honest with me and i just walked around outside today literally dazed with this sense of a loss of humanity. i guess all i can say is i hope he figures out what he wants and finds what he's looking for, and i don't think i can open myself up again like that, it just hurts too much and it's not worth it.

anyway i could ramble on more about this but if there's any guys out there (str8 gay bi i dont care) who understand what i'm talking about and can identify, i'd appreciate a decent guy who gets it and just wants to exist as friends. i'm pretty sad, but i'm sure things will improve over time and i'll get over it.

title: May I live with you please ?
text:
I am a lonely old man. I hate to admit it, but it's true.

I find myself on an emotional iceberg drifting every day further out to sea.

I am about to move
I am male, 65, progressive with a fondness for lesbians AS FRIENDS.

When I move it would be nice not to do so alone.

What would be ideal would be your welcoming me and my two cats into your home.

I will be putting some of my possessions in storage, including my treadmill and a few other items..

If you have the room for me and my cats with those items I otherwise will have to place in storage, that would be appreciated, but not vital.

I'm quite , play keyboard ( with head phones if needed ), I'm choosing not to smoke pot, though I certainly wouldn't mind if you did.

I prefer sharing my life with a lesbian based on previous experiences of compatiblity 

If she wasn't a violent alcoholic we'd still be living together, probably with her girlfriend , effectively as a triad, a family of three.

I'm computer and gadget literate.
I write and publish on Kindle.

That's basically it.

I'd rather you not wish me to join you just because you need the money. I'd hope for a sense of family, if you are not adverse to the concept.

I just need a place to sleep, and if possible a second area ( perhaps in a living room ) for my other items .

If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to ask.

Given the economy, and the way in this society there seem to be so many people alone who would rather not be alone, to me it seems both possible and desirable.

If you are male, or female, old or young, gay or straight, of another "race" ( what a foolish concept : there is racism but there is no such thing as race).

I figure I have four to eight weeks before I will have to finalize where I'm going.

I'm flexible.

Thank you

Steve

title: Married White man seeks Married Asian Woman for Friendship
text:
Hi. I would like to develop a good and close friendship with a married Asian woman. I'm specifying Asian for a few reasons. One is that my wife is Asian and I am very familiar with and fond of Asian people. Another is that (although I am posting here in the Platonic section), am looking to find a soulmate to develop a safe, discrete, on-going romantic friendship with, and while I find Asian women attractive in general, I am more attracted to the conservative values (social, moral, sexual) that I know Asian women possesses. I am not "a player" (one who get involved with many women) and I don't want to develop a special friendship with a woman who is. I am looking for a good, kind, educated, sensitive woman who would like to develop a romantic connection with a good, kind, educated, and sensitive man. If you are somewhat Conservative and Spiritual/Religious that would be a plus, as would any love for art, music, literature, old movies, etc. Ideally we would meet and slowly get to know one another, perhaps go for little short trips to some of he museums, parks, gardens that dot the Long Island area (mostly in the Nassau County area, since we both live in Queens). If, after we get to know each other an feel comfortable with each other we decide to become romantically involved, we would do so knowing that we both seek to be discrete, mutually respectful of each others safety and privacy. I am not just looking for sex, but for a comforting tenderness and affection without which sex is pretty meaningless.

If you find any of this even a little attractive too, please write and we can share our thoughts via emails until we feel comfortable enough to meet in person. Also, if you have ever thought that you would like to begin a relationship like this but have always been afraid o, then I want to say that I am very much the kind of man you would want to do this with, not just because I am good-looking and intellectually engaging and fun to be with, but specifically and most importantly because I am very conservative about this. I am dedicated to being safe, discrete, respectful, and totally private, and if you are too you are the only kind of woman I would want to be involved with. Besides mutual attraction, trust and safety are the most important. I am of northern European background, good looking, 6' tall, in good shape and a still young looking 62. I am retired and have my days generally free. Above all, I offer good companionship, good conversation, good listening, an complete discretion and privacy. Our relationship would be ongoing but totally private and secure. Another thing, I am not looking for anyone young. I would prefer if you were somewhere between the ages of 55 and 60 or a little older is ok too.

You're probably wondering why I'm doing this, since I am married. My wife and I have a very good relationship in terms of being well matched and friends. But after her menopause she has shown no interest in either sexual relations or even close cuddling. We are more like platonic friends, and it is not my nature to force myself on someone since the needed sense of mutual enjoyment is not there. I assume you would be in the same situation: all or most things good except for the romantic and physical side. I would prefer to be honest about this with my wife but I know she would not like it and it would hurt her. But I am not really content to live a celibate life in this way, and so I am looking for someone who matches me in many ways who might be looking for the same kind of private, secure, and safe romantic relationship that is missing at home.

title: Writing Friend
text:
"To earth belongs the solidity which sustains houses of stone and the steps of men (at least on its surface, for buried within the depths of the earth is the incandescence of lava)." - Bataille

Hello. I'm looking for someone to exchange emails with about ideas, art, literature, spirituality and philosophy, to put it simply. You should be a seeker, and interested in discussing mystics, thinkers, poets and artists from all over, from many different eras. You're hopefully sane (relatively; we're all a little crooked), funny, analytic, sensitive, poetic. You should be humble enough to be taught; happy, in turn, to teach. You can be partnered or not, but be okay with the idea of a respectful pen-pal friendship. Women tend most often to have the kind of energy-blend I'm looking for, but if you're a man who's stumbled upon this, and you feel like responding, go for it. 

We may meet, we may not -- probably not -- I don't care which -- what I care about is the quality and passion of your thinking and to what degree you can translate that to prose. To begin with: What question(s) are you wrestling with? And/or: What writer or artist or thinkers has stirred you recently to really struggle with a question there's no safe and simple answer for?

Folks you may be already interested in: Jung, Swedenborg, Freud, Dickinson, Whitman, beat poets, Nietzsche, Arendt, Gurdjieff, William James, Simone Weil, Jarod Lanier

title: Generous Philanthropist or Talented Cosmetic Surgeon Needed
text:
I had saved up for cosmetic surgery and the surgery was botched
athough when I had gone for several consultations with different surgeons
I was told that my requests and case were standard. The doctor's pamphlet 
was written in such a way to suggest that he has the credentials. The
ambulatory care facility was grand and in the same space as a world renowned
cosmetic surgeon so I assumed wrong that he must be very successful and must
be great at what he does. In the multiple followup visits to the doctor's office
after the surgery when it didn't look right and I looked overly swollen (I usually
heal very well), was told to allow time for it to heal. He didn't take any photos of it 
and told me to not visit any other surgeon. He then took photos of only one angle,
the angle which was always my best angle, and the one which mimicked the photo
in his brochure of one angle that is meant to appeal to those seeking a cute, feminine nose.
In order to produce a better version of that one angle he created a bump I did not have on 
the other side and on the bridge and a certain crookedness to the front. 
In the pre-op consultation he referred to the technique as an optical illusion. 
In the post-op he denied ever referring to such a technique. 
Many years after the nose didn't heal on it's own and I saw the reflection of a crooked nose, 
I started to use a nose clip to straighten it from the front. The front doesn't look crooked now 
from what I can tell, but the "optical illusion" bump and excess bone on the bridge is much 
more obvious from the front and side now that I'm not thrown by the crookedness. 
There's so much wrong with it in terms of work being done, including not be able to breathe as well. 

In post-op, he made all sorts of excuses as to why the tip flares saying it's because the tip 
was lifted and noses look funny when people smile. I would think that if you're going to 
lift the tip you'd make sure the nostrils are symmetrical. I've seen tons of people smile where 
their nostrils don't flare and their tip doesn't look weird from the front and sides when smiling. 
Disliking the tip and it being too long is the reason I wanted cosmetic surgery in the first place. 
Years after surgery I have the same concerns as pre-op, just a different version and a bump added 
for good measure. No optical illusion. 
The doctor also never told me to massage the bridge while it was healing,
and never warned me to avoid contact sports and not workout for 6 weeks. 
He only emphasized the first few days after surgery and to take it easy for the first 2 weeks. 

Not having had any "work" pre-op I honestly didn't know what to look for 
and went solely on the first hand recommendation of models and the warm personality
of the doctor. I learned after the fact the importance of choosing a board certified 
plastic and reconstructive cosmetic surgeon. He was board eligible not certified. 
I learned after the fact, that he didn't attend medical school in the US.
He's an ear, nose and throat guy. He seems more focused on plastic, not cosmetic.
He's not a board certified cosmetic surgeon, he's board eligible and has been for years. 

Long story short, I don't trust returning to the same surgeon although he did offer 
the revision if I cover the fees for the outpatient facility and anesthesia. Everyone
who saw me after the surgery who knew what I looked like before said that I went
to the wrong doctor. Ya think?

I've been so traumatized that I feel stuck and can't pursue my dreams.
I'm in a field and must run in circles surrounded by the beautiful people
where looks, networking and being in the public eye are critical to success.
I constantly have kept to the side lines when I want to be in the limelight.
Cosmetic issues have been holding me back in any number of professional
situations where it's not natural for me to just jump into a photo and smile.
I guess if I'm being perfectly honest, I could use some media coaching and
a great cosmetic dentist too since some of my teeth have chipped a little
and the dentist I've most recently visited can't seem to get the crown right
where I keep going back and it's just not done right so I've refused to accept it.

I obviously can't turn back to choose other doctors or save up more to see 
doctors who would have assured excellent results, but I can focus on hope
and the future.

I'm glad to say that after this experience, I've done my homework and know 
what to ask and what to look for. I also have a list of the top cosmetic surgeons
in the US and in NY. I just can't afford the expense with the expenses I already have
and going into debt is not the way to kick off a career. I've also learned that the best 
work is undetectable and some of the most successful and confident people have had 
work done and it's made them feel great whether a smile makeover to make them feel 
more comfortable to quickly smile, eyes done so they don't look tired or sad all the time, 
or a nose to be more proportionate to their features. I can use all of these with the latter
being the most important. I would benefit from media training and coaching as well.

If you're able to donate to this cause or know someone who earnestly can 
without the usual sordid craiglist shenanigans, then please get back to me
with the means to reach you and what it is that you're contributing to this cause.

This is not an ad for opinions on whether I should get work done, it's for those
who are supportive of me doing what needs to be done to achieve my dreams.

Thank you for your time. Have a great weekend.

title: Writing Friend Wanted
text:
Greetings, Creative Ones!

I'm a writer (of fiction and poetry) who is interested in finding another literary-minded person for mutual support and constructive criticism. This could be something like a writers' group, but for two. While we could trade work and comments via the web, I'm most interested in meeting face-to-face regularly in NYC (I'm happy to travel wherever the subways can get me).

Though I write fiction in various genres, I am focusing upon contemporary fantasy and science fiction at this time. I do enjoy many different kinds of fiction from mainstream and literary through several of the genre ghettos. Whatever it is that you write, the person I am looking for must have an appreciation for contemporary fantasy and science fiction - if you don't, then we probably aren't a good match.

As for poetry, I'm open to many different styles.

What creative endeavors are you pursuing at the moment?

If you are passionate about writing and strive to improve your art, then I'd love to work with you. For me, writing is a vocation that demands far greater effort than a hobby would. 

If this sounds at all interesting to you, please do reply! I'm open to any ideas along these lines.

I hope you all have an amazing, productive day!

title: Please give me two million dollars
text:
Imagine you are walking by on a busy city street and you see a person in need. They make their need clear and through obvious means, but they aren't bothering anyone (ex: a person sitting cross legged with their palms out and a sign).

You are in the position to easily change their life by giving them a bit of what you have, that you aren't using, that isn't going to change your daily life whether you give it away or not. Regardless of how much work you've put in, you aren't going to miss it, since it isn't doing anything sitting in the bank or in a stockpile somewhere.

You aren't giving to them because they are sick or have some kind of defect or because they are poor. This is above that. There's no pity or emotion. This is about giving because you are in the position to do so, and because you can. Nothing more.

Quietly, you slip into this person's hand something that has the potential to change their life - a check for an inconsequential amount to you, but more than a lifetime's worth for them. 

You leave it to fate to see what happens, with no regrets. This act of kindness (or a gamble as some may see it) will just be between you and the One upstairs. 

Who knows - you may see this person again someday, but it's more likely they will fade into the background never to be heard from again. But you can rest easy knowing you've done a good deed and given someone a chance - an opportunity that you know you would have taken if it had ever happened to you.

You walk on and continue with your life. This is just another day. You've given back to the universe just as it has given to you, and life is good.

All I ask is that if you are interested, to meet for coffee and talk.. that?s all I ask. IN PUBLIC of course so u feel SAFE.. and play it all by ear from there.

Boudoir, for those who don't know, started primarily in the bedrooms of women who wanted tasteful shots of themselves in their bedrooms (boudoir!). As that intimate style of photography grew and changed, some photographers have turned their attention to men who'd like similar photographs. 

Though a quick search will reveal Adonis physiques and studio environments, my style of boudoir (dudeoir?) focuses more on the person and their relationship with their environments. Whether skinny, overweight, or obese, your body type is irrelevant to what I am looking for. You must be a person who is comfortable enough with yourself to have a camera in front of your capturing your intimate best. My experience shooting landscapes has taught me the importance of taking into account the setting, so your bedroom or any other place you feel comfortable in would be the ideal place to shoot.

Though I would like to use these for my portfolio, where they go is up to you. Perhaps you've made some progress with your work out routing. Perhaps you want photos to share with your partner(s). Maybe you just want the experience. Whatever the reason, these photos are for you and won't go on my portfolio unless you OK it.

So if this sounds remotely interesting to you, please message me! I do provide free consultations to meet and get to know each other to get comfortable and discuss the shoot in more detail (what kind of photos, where the shoot will go down, time, etc). Even if you don't plan on shooting soon, do the consult!

-Nelson Vidals (red x)
www.redxboudoir.tumblr.com/

title: I Love Being Alone! Loneliness is Awesome Too! - Said No One Ever!
text:
I've been alone, in my life, but with the hope, and belief that, someday, I will be able to connect with someone - as I always have. I've been in LTRs for 21 years. I've had 4 very INsignificant others who all cheated and left me for dead (not literally). And with each broken heart, I always swore the same "NEVER AGAIN!" mantra , but..stupid is as stupid does, and stupid me always gave my heart out like a discount store flier in Times Sq. Heartache, disappointment, and now...hopelessness. I no longer believe that I will find anyone who I can truly, deeply connect with. I've abandoned the hope of ever having what every human organically needs: Companionship and Unconditional love. A best friend and lover in one total package. No biggie for most people, but for me, it seems an impossible dream. Like trying to find an honest politician, or a taxi driver in Manhattan who has a clue where the hell he's going. None of these exist. And this is where being "alone" ends, and being "lonely" begins. My world is devoid of intimacy, romance, true friendship, and someone who will laugh at my jokes even when they are not funny - even though ALL my jokes are fucking hilarious! Just sayin. I'm typing this on a dark, dreary, rainy night - the time best spent wrapped in puffy blankets, feeling the body heat of that special someone, held tightly against you, and you literally melt into each other's souls. I live for that bliss, but I've lost hope of ever having it ever again. There's always a needle in the haystack, but I'm tired of getting pricked in my ass searching for it. I'm not a pessimist, I'm a realist. I've given the very core of my being to too many, too often, only to be used, abused, and left for...CL. Above me, is the dude who wants to "mentor" aka fuck some teenage college student, and below me, a zoomed in closeup of a cock from Jurassic Park, seeking an "NSA FWB WITH AN BBW." Actually, he's really a Nigerian scammer, as 98% of these ads are, but hey - a little identity theft never hurt anyone, now did it?
This is what I'm reduced (or elevated?) to. 
So what am I looking for? Why post this? Don't know. Maybe I'll make a cool email buddy or phone friend, or someone who can relate to me? Misery lusts company. I think just going with the flow is my best bet. Whatever or whoever comes of this post...welcome to my world. Have a seat. Tell me about you. It's not Twitter, so feel free to exceed the 140 word limit. 
I'm a white guy, a certified Personal Trainer (with abs of steel;), no kids, a nature and animal lover, sensual, intensely sexual, funnier than Sophia Viagra's version of English, and lonely why? (insert Final Jeopardy music here
*I AM A MAN*MAN*MAN*MAN*MAN*PLEASE NO MORE DICK PICS !

title: Are You a Writer?
text:
Greetings, Creative Ones!

I'm a writer (of fiction and poetry) who is interested in finding another literary-minded person for mutual support and constructive criticism. This could be something like a writers' group, but for two. While we could trade work and comments via the web, I'm most interested in meeting face-to-face regularly in NYC (I'm happy to travel wherever the subways can get me).

Though I write fiction in various genres, I am focusing upon contemporary fantasy and science fiction at this time. I do enjoy many different kinds of fiction from mainstream and literary through several of the genre ghettos. Whatever it is that you write, the person I am looking for must have an appreciation for contemporary fantasy and science fiction - if you don't, then we probably aren't a good match.

As for poetry, I'm open to many different styles.

What creative endeavors are you pursuing at the moment?
